40001.name: Mars
40001.description:
From the Tilsit website:

Each player is appointed to lead an expedition that has set up a colony on Mars. You need to manage your best sources of raw materials, energy and settlers to build your military, scientific or economic interests and be the first to get the number of victory points set at the beginning of the game. However the Red Planet is an inhospitable place and any error in managing your resources may cost you in this race for development.

40002.description:
Adaptation of The Sword and the Flame for the conflict between the British and the pirates of the South China Sea in the middle of the 19th century.

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level Wargame rules that will recreate the exciting Land and Sea Battles between the Trading Powers of the World and the Pirates of the South Seas."

The peoples of Borneo and other nearby islands did a lot of fishing, which gave them opportunity for occasional informal piracy for millennia, until the British showed up and took umbrage. This lead to many small battle between British troops and the Dyak, Malay, Illunan, and even Chinese. Ultimately British adventurer James Brooke's alliance with the Sultan of Brunei lead to his creation as the "White Raja of Sarawak" as he ruled part of Borneo while fighting the pirates.

Includes movement and combat rules for European sailing ships, junks, and various war canoes, grappling, and bombs, as well as the various tribes and special "Bravado" morale rules for the Dyak and Malay, who fight better with Gongs, insults, and enemy casualties.

Twenty-two pages including reference.
40002.name: The Kris And The Flame

40003.description:
Adaptation of The Sword and the Flame for Caesar’s Gallic Wars 58-51 BC by the original designer.

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level Wargame rules that can recreate the excitement and savagery of the countless forays, skirmishes and raids along the frontiers of Rome."

Includes appropriate force composition, rules for assaulting palisades with ladders, and notes on using the system for the Roman Civil War. Both armor type and formation type strongly influence combat. Fourteen pages including reference and preface but excluding ads.
40003.name: The Sword In Gaul

40004.description:
California Rummy is a 3 – 8 player variant of the standard deck playing card game Contract Rummy. Seven hands are played with each initial meld requirement of “sets” and/or “runs” getting progressively harder each time. As the requirements go up so do the number of cards dealt.

The game uses “draw and discard” mechanics as well as the ability for anyone in the game to “buy” a card if the player whose turn it is does not want the card. The card is purchased by also taking a “penalty card” from the unused stock.

An individual hand ends when one player goes out by either melding or “laying off” all of their cards in hand. All others count their hand point totals against them. At the end of the 7 rounds, the player with the least amount of total points is the winner.
40004.name: Contract Rummy
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

boardgamehonor: 2009 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2010 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2010 Lys Enfant Finalist
40005.description:
Bring your camels to the oasis. The camels are moved by cards and the players have to think about which card to play for a good move. The plans of the others could be disturbed by playing a sandstorm so that all the cards have to be shuffled.
The first six camels in the oasis score points and the player with the most points wins the game.


2010 Golden_Ace - nominated for French Game of the Year
40005.name: Karawane

40006.description:
The players are ants building an anthill. They have to finish the anthill before Anthony the anteater reaches them, because only then the ants are safe from Anthony's long trunk. To build the anthill, the players have to find twigs on the back of the path cards. These twigs have to be collected and brought to the anthill, but this only works if a continuous line of ants leads up to them.
It's a cooperative game, but the rulebook contains a competition variation as well.
40006.name: Herkules Ameise

40007.name: Medio-Milenio
40007.description:
Medio-Milenio is a trivia game based on the relationship between Spain and Latin America. Its main theme is the encounter among the two worlds.
In the game, this encounter is reflected as a journey depicted on the board between Europe and America or the other way round. The players can choose where to start their journey and will be answering questions during it.
The questions have four different levels and are all related with the history, arts, tradition and facts of the two continents.

The game was released as a commemoration of the 500th anniversary of Christopher Columbus' reaching landfall in America in 1492.

40008.name: Alba
40008.description: Alba is played on a 7 x 7 board with the inner 5 x 5 area used for the initial setting, the middle cell is left empty. Red and Blue place their pieces in turn, the neutral (white) side is on the bottom. Then players start to move to neighboring cells or try to jump hostile pieces. The jumped or the jumping piece is then flipped. The aim of the game is to neutralize the opposing forces by flipping or by reaching a cell on the edge of the board or even by jumping overboard.

40009.name: Krypton
40009.description: Krypton is played on a 7×7 board with the corners and the middle cell being left empty. Among the friendly pieces four marked men are hidden, who can only be recognized from the backside. Aim of the game is to occupy both hostile corners with the marked men or to capture at least three marked hostile pieces.

40010.name: Osmosis
40010.description:
Osmosis is a race game from the corners to the center of the board driven by two six-sided dice. Pieces‘ way may be shortened when reaching certain positions:
Two own pieces of different colors must reach the same cell or the cell lying exactly opposite on the same ring. That player wins who manages to bring both a man of his two different colors to the center. Generally, not the lucky one will win Osmosis, but the one with better experience in the calculus of probability.

40011.name: Adversa
40011.description: Adversa is for those who know the game of Surakarta: But this war game has been changed into a positional game where groups of four are to be formed. As in Surakarta some edge cells are supposed to be connected, the same is in Adversa but with two rings more. Diagonal moves may lead over the edges, then changing direction in a right angle. Object of the game is to decimate opponent’s forces to less than four.

40012.name: Diamonds
40012.description:
Diamonds is a positional game with the object of forming groups of four pieces of any size. All men move like the Queen in Chess with the additional force of over-leaping friendly and hostile pieces. Whoever forms a diamond may
decimate opponent’s forces. The player loses when he/she has only three men left.

40013.name: Kuala
40013.description: Kuala has the object of building a tower of five elements height and is played on a 49-cell board. Pieces initially are arranged as shown in the photo. If a piece is standing in front of an opposite man and the cell beyond is occupied by a friendly stone, it may jump on this friendly stone. A stone standing in front of a hostile piece and the cell immediately beyond being empty may capture the enemy piece like in Laska. A column sandwiched between two hostile pieces becomes immobile until one of the two stones is captured.

40014.name: Carree
40014.description: Carree is played on an octagonal 3×4 board, which is initially empty. Players try to sandwich hostile pieces (custodian capture) or to move between them (intervention capture). A player loses when he/she has only four men left. Pieces may move over the edges of the board thus changing direction in a right angle.

40015.name: Matris
40015.description:
The game consist of a number of bricks randomly placed in a matrix. Each brick has a known value. The players alternate in picking the bricks, one horizontally and the other vertically.

The name of the game in Swedish has two different meanings "matrix" and "food rice", and the game is actually published by a swedish food producer.

40016.name: Bilder Galerie
40016.description: Players collect complete pictures that consist of four pieces each. The pieces are stacked up in eight stacks in the middle of the table, partly visible. The players try to get the pieces they need and block other players' plans (they can take pieces away from unfinished pictures). Whoever completes the most pictures is the winner.

40017.name: China Dragon
40017.description: Tiles with pictures of dragon parts are placed on the table and marked with chips of the player who placed them. The goal is to get the longest continuous chain of tiles marked with your own color. The tiles form a picture of intertwined dragons.

40018.name: Cowboys
40018.description:
Players play for tricks while trying to get rid of their cards first. Whoever cannot follow the suit of cards with which the first player opened, has to take all the cards that have already been played in this trick.

One of Piatnik's 1989 "Texas-Serie".

40019.name: Das Rotkäppchen-Spiel
40019.description: One player plays Rotkäppchen (Little Red Riding Hood), the other plays the wolf. Little Red Riding Hood runs through the forest and trying not to be seen by the wolf. Game goal is for Red Riding Hood, to reach the blue and white box in the corners and then come to the meadow in the middle of the plan, without being seen by the wolf. The wolf has won, if he even sees Little Red Riding Hood. The cards are stacked face down and players take turns, depending on the card, Red Riding Hood may move in all directions, the wolf may move only horizontally and vertically. The wolf sees Little Red Riding Hood if an imaginary line between the two sites is not running on a dark green tree field.

40020.name: Tip 'n' Tap
40020.description: Tip 'n' Tap Game by Whitman. It is dated 1965 Western Publishing Co. Comes with 6 balls. Object of the game is to place the balls on one side of the gameboard and then with a slight tap of a center button send those balls to the other side where depending on where they finish scores points.

40022.name: Backe backe Kuchen
40022.description: The players collect ingredients for baking a cake. The ingredients are colored markers that are collected by rolling dice. Once the ingredients are complete, the players roll a "baking die" with which they move forward on a clock. When a player completes the baking time, he or she is the winner.

40023.name: Angeschmiert
40023.description: This game contains unusual (patented by the author, actually) 4-sided dice. With these, the players roll color combinations with certain values (seen in a chart in the middle of the game board) to determine how fast they can move.

40024.name: Heimweh
40024.description: Satirical game in which the object is to rent an apartment. In order to do this, you have to drop off your children and pets in a shelter, rob other players of their money, buy forged documents etc. Most of these actions are achieved by simple dice rolls.

40025.name: Alle Vögel sind schon da
40025.description:
A game master reads or sings the beginning of a children's song or chant. The children players then have to find a tile with a picture that matches the song/chant.
It is a same game as later published Jetzt fahrn wir ubern See (Drei Magier Spiele)

40026.name: Ätsch
40026.description: Luck based combined card/dice game. A player rolls two dice which determine whether he or she can put a card openly in front of him or her. There are some special cards that allow placing cards face down in front of another player, which then count negative points. When a player runs out of hand cards, the game ends. Open cards count plus, face down cards count minus points.

40027.name: Fat Sam
40027.description: Fat Sam is a spin and move, memory game. From the box cover: "The wildest wackiest memory game ever featuring the world's craziest bunch of characters." Game comes with a Fat Sam spinner and a bunch of Character cards.

40028.name: Vamoose
40028.description:
This is one of a series of abstract strategy games from Wales Game Systems, all branded with a Western theme after another of their games, 64-32 Ranch Roundup.

Description taken from inside the game's box:

EQUIPMENT

Board: The playing board consists of four home sections, each having nine numbered circles upon which are placed the nine playing pieces of one color, each piece on its own number.

Playing Pieces: Four sets of playing pieces are provided. Use the cowboys numbered from 1 to 9.

Play Money: $800.00 in 64-32 Ranch Play Money is provided. Before the game this money is divided so each player has $200.00.

OBJECT

The object of the game is for each player to advance his cowboys around the board by moving and jumping until all of them have been returned to their respective starting positions in the home corral. The first player to complete the moving of all his cowboys around the board wins his game.

40029.name: Drops
40029.description: Three chips ("drops") are placed randomly on the 3 x 3 gameboard. A game master then draws a card which contains a pattern. The players take turn in moving individual drops on the board, and the game master tells them how many are in the right positions. The first player to build the correct pattern gets the card; whoever has most cards at the end of the game, wins.

40030.name: Afterwords
40030.description:
From the designer's website:

"Combines the best elements of Scrabble®, Boggle® & Bingo! Each Player controls their own board, and as letters are randomly selected, decides where to place them. The player who makes the highest scoring words wins! Play solitaire or with any number of friends."

40031.name: Independence!
40031.description:
From the rules:

"Independence! is a strategy game for 3-5 Players, who compete as Colonial Governors during the American revolution. A game is comprised of three years, and each year Players select a new Colony to govern. There are two turns in each year; six turns in a complete game (or 5 turns in a short game).

Independence! is based on historical facts about the 13 original colonies, and the major events of that time period. However, the wide variety of Player choices and random events cause each game of Independence! to develop differently."

40032.name: Star Empire
40032.description:
From the designer's site:

"A 2-person space epic for board gamers, inspired by Master of Orion ®, my favorite PC game. Managing your empire’s resources is critical as you expand from a single star system to the dominant power in the galaxy. Incredible diversity, yet can be played in a single evening."

40033.name: Army For Sale
40033.description:
From the designer's site:

"A bidding/military conquest game for 3 or 4 players. Recruit the best officers to lead your armies in Part I of the game, then choose how to deploy them in a battle for Europe in part II. Medici ® players will love the myriad of factors that influence the bidding, and fans of Stratego ® will appreciate the familiar officer corps."

40034.name: Four Score
40034.description:
From the designer's site:

"A challenging word game for 2 or more players. Each player gets their own board and a set of blue, green and gold tiles. Each round, players draw 4 of each color tile, then arrange the tiles to form words on their board. The trick is that in any word, only one color tile will score at full value. Double squares and secret wagers add to the excitement."

40036.name: Space Ace
40036.description:
From the designer's site:

"A futuristic 'fighter pilot' game for 2 to 4 players. Players’ ships circle the solar system, shifting orbits and speeds to gain position on their targets. Beautiful components simulate the cockpit of your starship, while special technology cards and random planet placement insure that each game will present new challenges."

40037.name: Space Chess
40037.description:
From the rules:

"Space Chess is a futuristic strategy game for 2 people. The download package includes a 14"x14" game board (separated into 2 files for printing), red and blue Fleet Strength sheets, red and blue Fleet Orders pads, red and blue King pads, and all pieces needed for the game.

Each player commands a fleet of 6 ships, represented by chess pieces on the game board, and by icons on Fleet Order pads (you can use either chess pieces from a small chess set for movement on the board, or ship tokens, which are included).

The game board is divided into 64 Quadrants. A Quadrant is made up of 9 Sectors, each referred to by its compass position in the Quadrant: N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW and C(enter). There are three types of Quadrants: Type I (Light Red), Type II (Light Green) and Type III (Yellow). Both Quadrant Type and Sector location affect ship movement and combat capabilities.

The object of the game is to locate and destroy your opponent’s King ship. King ships are initially placed on King pads rather than on the game board, keeping their location hidden."

40038.name: Mayor of Metropolis
40038.description:
From the rules:

"Welcome to Mayor of Metropolis!® This unique game of real estate development for 2-4 players offers far more choices, and demands more complex strategies than other real estate games. Amazingly, games progress quickly, and victory is often achieved in less than one hour.

Streets in Mayor of Metropolis® are five blocks long. Properties can be developed with homes, condos or retail stores. Because you don't need a 'monopoly' to build, you will constantly be making choices about where to build, what to build and when to build.

Players can see at a glance who owns every property by simply by looking at their CityPad.® You'll have chances to speculate in rural land, municipal bonds to bid for, and most importantly, an elections strategy to plan.

In Mayor of Metropolis®, you can win by popularity with the voters, as well as through sheer economic power. Since the elections occur at different times in each game, you'll spend countless hours trying to develop winning strategies!"

40039.name: Space Trader
40039.description:
From the rules:

"Space Trader is a bidding strategy game for 2 or 3 Players, in which a contest is held by selected member worlds of the Alliance. Players are given comparable cargo holds of Goods. Each world desires different types of Goods, such as weapons or chocolate, and will award Credits to the Player who offers them the highest quantity of the goods they want. After 3 rounds of trading, the Player with the most Credits wins."

40040.name: Alpha Base
40040.description:
From the designer's site:

"A multi-player colony development game, inspired by Outpost ® . Each player decides the best way to grow their colony, with lots of bidding and resource allocation throughout the game. Alpha Base delivers three hours of challenging choices and intense competition!"

40041.name: The Challenge
40041.description:
From the designer's site:

"An exciting game of strategy for 2 players. Through bidding, purchases and training, both players prepare their knights for the duel that will determine the winner. Each of the game's four stages rewards a different type of skill, so the possibilities are amazing!"

40042.name: Color My Word
40042.description:
From the designer's site:

"An easy to learn word game for 2 or 3 players. Letters are Red, Green and Blue Tiles, with White and Gold special Tiles. Tiles only score if they're placed on the right color square!"

40043.name: Balance of Power
40043.description:
From the designer's site:

"A 2-person war game played on a different map each time. Loads of strategic and tactical decisions involving air, land and sea forces, circa mid-20th century technology. Acetate overlays allow for force reductions and map changes. Only for the serious... games last 20-40 hours."

40044.name: States
40044.description:
Each card represents a State of the USA; players compete to create a hand of four adjacent States or alternatively a hand of same colour States with the highest point value.

From the designer's site:

"In this colorful card game for children and adults, each card is a different state. You can't help but learn geography when playing STATES; instead of memorizing, you learn by understanding."

40045.name: Married!  The Game of Marriage and Money
40045.description:
From the back of the box:

"This exciting, positive game offers lots of fun as it takes you through the ups and downs of marriage and money-making. There's the opportunity to win it all or lose it all on the draw of a single card...

A game that is as modern as today, yet as old as marriage itself..."

40046.description:
The publisher Dargaud usually releases comic books in France like Asterix or Lucky Luke.

So this game is featuring the Wild West hero Lucky Luke.

The game is outstandingly equipped with components.
You have among others a stagecoach traveling around the outer track, a loco traveling the inner track, workers in two different colours, signals, road blocks, a lot of play money and last but not least hundreds of cardboard rail segments in 3 different colours.

Aim of the game is to connect the eastern and western borders of the USA.
To achieve this you have to travel with your stagecoach in order to collect building material and to hire workers.
These have to be delivered to your hometown, and from then on you can choose what to do with your dice roll: Move on with your stagecoach or move your loco on the inner board to build the rails in order to achieve your goal first.

But beware: You have to maximize your money profits (railway building is expensive !!!) and to avoid your opponents who can rob your stagecoach or steal your stocks in hometown, because the loco can only transport as much as you have hired workers.

And even further your opponents can hinder your track building by forcing to add bridges to your railway or to make your workers flee from your company.

But one of the players can count for the help of the name-giving comic hero !

Winner is the first player to complete the track, build a second hometown and then travels back with his loco to his starting depot.
40046.name: Lucky Luke: Union Pacific vs. Central Pacific

40047.name: Canada
40047.description:
On July 1, 1867, four of Britain's North American colonies united to form a self-governing dominion: Canada.

Canada is a game for three players covering the history of Canada from Confederation to the end of the Second World War.

Each player assumes the role of a political party striving to establish a legacy greater than its rivals’ by taking positions on political issues, winning elections, and expanding the dominion’s frontiers. To succeed, players will have to co-operate as well as compete. The winner will be the player who can best balance co-operation with competition.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2009 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Second Place
40048.description: Klaus the mouse traveled around the world and took a lot of pictures of many different things. But a strong wind mixed up all his pictures. The aim of the game is to help Klaus to spatialize the things to the continents where they originally come from. Therefore the players place their figure on a map of the world. If it is placed on the right continent, they get a chip. The first one who gets the 10th chip wins the game.
40048.name: Klaus die Maus entdeckt die Welt

40049.name: INTRIKY
40049.description:
Is card game from the world of mafia. Each player is trying to reach the significant part of the most powerful people in the city. Be the first who control at least four of them and the city "victory" is yours.
Cards are divided in 3 categories
- Intriguer - necessary for activation of sentences
- Intrigue card - most in game - have 4 different meanings
1 - for composing of sentences (intrigues)
2 - symbol in right corner - sentences from cards with same symbol gives you additional advantage
3 - represent money
4 - can be played as single card
- Cards of powerful people in city (provost, taxi driver, pilot, murder, thief, ....)

Game is based on drawing a cards from witch you compose the sentences (each card contain part of the sentence), Longer sentences allow you to make more complex and powerful actions.
In each turn, you can just draw one card, and play one card.
Other advantages depend on composed sentences (intrigues).
Rules of the game are quit simple and in fact almost everything is allowed, so also depends on you how you are able to control and make deals with other players.

Simply - Fast and funny party game

40050.name: Save The Selkie
40050.description:
Each player chooses a magical creature to be their game piece. Players explore an island, gathering clues until they find the Selkie skin and defeat the guardian creature.

A spinner built into the board determines movement as well as battle outcomes. Players move to different parts of the board and make a hypothesis. This involves telling another player what you think is the creature guarding the Selkie's skin, and what part of the island. If that player is holding either card, they must reveal one, disproving the player's hypothesis. A player who thinks he or she knows the answers can make a guess and check the set aside cards. If they are incorrect, the player must go back to Start.

When a player guesses correctly, they must spin the spinner for a battle. If they spin the right magic weapon, they win the game. If they don't, the other players get to move.

40051.name: Dig & Play Dinosaurs World
40051.description: Dig & Play Dinosaurs World is a kit which includes a block from which children can "excavate" dinosaurs, which then become the playing pieces in the roll-and-move board game.

40052.name: Squire Fight
40052.description:
Squire Fight is a game played on a three by three grid. A spinner or die is used for movement on the grid, then used to decide the result of combat. When a player loses ten "hit points," he/she is out of the game.

This game is found in the book "Knight: A Noble Guide for Young Squires."

40053.name: Ponyville Adventure Game
40053.description:
Be the first of My Little Pony characters to reach the Celebration Castle in Ponyville by stopping at every Rainbow space along the path to collect your six character tokens.

The youngest player starts. On your turn, spin the spinner and see which color it lands on. Move your pony to the next space of that color on the path. If another pony is already on the space move along to the path of the next available space of that color (unless it is the Rainbow space which can have more than one pony). If you land on or pass a Rainbow space, collect your pony's unique token.

Pony characters are: Sweetie Belle, Pinkie Pie, Starsong, Scootaloo, Cheerilee, Toola-Roola, and Rainbow Dash.

40054.name: Food Fight!
40054.description:
Players are considered to have wandered into the middle of a food fight. During the game each player (or team-member when playing with 4) throw food at each other, trying to gain the least food cards in front of them ("on them" in theme).

The game consists of 3 rounds. Each round begins with setting up the cafeteria table (2 stacks of cards to draft from). Each player in turn order chooses to one of three things: take 1 card, swap a card, throw food.

Each option will result in adding cards to your hand or giving them to your opponent(s). At the end of the last round all players add up how many types of food they have on them. The player with the least amount is declared the winner.

40055.name: Sports Fuzz
40055.description:
Sports Fuzz is a stand-alone game of stuffed toys and action figures playing a game of Fuzzball which oddly resembles American Football. The game is set in the "Fuzzy Heroes" world of FrolicHaven and pits Fuzzy Heroes vs Renegade teams for control of a folded paper football here called a Fuzzball.

Published by Inner City Games Design - Sports Fuzz! uses a variant of the Fuzzy Heroes miniatures combat system which stats the players based on toy size, colour and other factors and tosses in a fairly elaborate rules set for Football as played by toys. The game is not though compatible with the other Fuzzy Heroes games. The playing field can be a large table, a bed or better yet the floor. The triangular paper Fuzzball is flicked across the playing field by the team "Coach".

40056.name: Tour de la Guadeloupe
40056.description: French cycling game about a lesser know race, the Tour of Guadeloupe, a race on a French island group in the Caribbean. The game comes with 24 cyclists, 4 for each player.

40057.name: Criterium de la Mère Picon
40057.description:
French cycling game from the 1950's. Four teams of 4 cyclists representing the countries France, Switzerland, Italy & Germany fight for victory. The mechanics are a combination of die with a spinner.

This game was a promotion for the "Mère Picon" cheese makers. Each cheese portion box included a cut-up rider and a bonus. If you sent 20 of these bonuses, you received the board.

40058.name: Les 6 Jours
40058.description: French cycling game from the '50s based on the 6 day indoor cycling events. Original is that the metal cyclists are standing on a small plate that allows them to swing.

40060.name: Veilig Voorop Spel
40060.description: Dutch mountain bike game that was published in Dordrecht. The game features 4 pawns and simple roll & move mechanics on a board that measures 46x32 cm.)

40061.name: ABX Forces
40061.description: Belgian cycling game released as a promotional game for ABX Logistics. The board is rather big, measuring 69x49cm and comes with 6 cupboard pawns and 54 cards. Movement is not decided by dice but by playing out action cards. Incidents like a flat tyre, a fall or a broken pedal could happen.

40062.name: Le Tour de Piste
40062.description: French indoor cycling game that won a price at the Concours Lépine International in Paris. The board is quite large, measuring 81x51 cm. and the box contains 6 teams with 4 wooden cyclists and a dernyrider (generic for a small pacing motorcycle and rider used in cycle races). There also is a pawn to count the game turns and there are 8 cards to determine the starting order.

40063.name: Day Trip Rhode Island
boardgamepublisher: State of Mind Product Design, Inc.
boardgameversion: State of Mind Product Design, Inc. Edition
40063.description: Players travel throughout the state of Rhode Island, answering trivia questions and collecting four specific postcards before returning to the central post office.

40064.name: Trivial Pursuit: Kansallispainos
40064.description: This is expansion card set for Trivial Pursuit. Kansallispainos is Finnish and it just means national edition. So here you have 250 cards with 1500 questions about Finland and matters concerning Finnish people. Of course the questions and answers are in Finnish.

40065.description:
Conquer the world by building house on the 7 continents. Place is limited and soon you'll have to build on top of the other player's houses. Will you try to burn their house, have lightning fall on their houses?

Once all cards have been placed, each continent is counted, the player who has the majority on the continent wins the continent, the player who wins the most continents is the winner.
40065.name: Défifoo Orange: Conquête du Monde

40066.name: Die Maus: Mit Köpfchen
40066.description:
Die Maus - Mit Köpfchen is a fast childrens word guessing game.

One player turns over one of 33 cards showing terms like 'A meal with...', 'A toy with...', 'A pet with...'. Then he rolls 6 dice. 5 dice (each with a different color) show letters. The sixth die is a colored die that indicates which of the letter dice is to be used. If it shows the white color any player can choose any rolled letter die he wants. Now all players simultaneously try to guess a word corresponding to the term on the card that starts with the rolled letter. The first players that finds a word gets the card as prize.

The game stops when all cards are won by the players. The player with the most cards wins the game.

40067.name: Gratuity Not Included
40067.description:
Gratuity Not Included is a fast paced card game placed in a restaurant during the Friday night rush. Each player grabs their server’s apron, a stack of menus and their handy notepad to seat patrons and fill orders.

A player's section of the restaurant has a number of tables depending on game length. Patrons are placed on the tables and wait for service. Players must play food and drink cards on patrons according to their tastes. When orders are filled the patron will ‘tip’ a portion of the meal cost to the player.
The goal is to get the most tips.

Gratuity Not Included is currently in Alpha rules development and playtesting.

40068.name: Reader's Digest Word Power
40068.description:
This board game from Reader's Digest puts your knowledge of words to the test in your quest to become the Word Power champion. But watch out - Wild Cards, Power Cards or the roll of the dice will move you along, set you back or even help foil your opponents.

Contents:
Game Board
700 Challenge Cards (2100 challenges in total)
50 Power Cards
30 Wild Cards
6 game pieces
1 dice and dice-throwing cup

40069.name: High School Musical 3 CD Board Game
40069.description: It's Senior Year at East High. Join the High School Musical gang as they face their hopes, dreams and their fears on the way to the graduation stage. Along the way players answer trivia questions and sing & dance a bit. The interactive music game CD adds to the fun! All packed in a neat portfolio case. For 2 or more players Ages 7 and up

40070.name: Fairy-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
40070.description:
From the back cover:

"Fairy-opoly is a game that allows imaginations to flutter and soar! Players collect fairy friends, give those fairies a pair of wings, and collect acorns each time another player lands on their space. Oh, the friends that can be made!

"Sprinkle your pretend fairy dust and advance to Twinkle. Enter a world of lively little fairies with positive messages to share. There is magic in believing! You two can be a fairy!"

The game ends the moment one person goes broke.

40071.name: Fairy Finds Game
40071.description:
From the enclosed instructions:

Players (both readers and non-readers) work together in this co-operative game, using a combination of luck and simple strategy to help the fairies build a Fairy Ring. As with all fine fairy tales, there lurks a tricky troll in the background who would rather take over the beautiful Fairy Ring site for himself. A roll of the die can work in his favor, so players must figure out a strategy, using the fairy cards, to foil both the troll and lady luck.

40072.name: Domo Caption This! Game
40072.description:
From the box:

Domo and his friends have been taking lots of pictures and now they're challenging you and your friends to a game where being clever, funny or outright outrageous can make you the winner.

Turn over a picture card and secretly write down a caption. It can be anything as long as one of the words you use comes from the Domo word card. If the rater chooses yours as the best, you collect a token. Once everyone has been the rater three times, the player with the most tokens wins.

Contents:
75 picture cards
100 word cards
25 scoring chips
pad of paper
rules

40073.name: Summer Heights High
40073.description:
Based on the Australian television show, in Summer Heights High: the popularity board game players must try to earn the most popularity points. Popularity points are used as a form of currency to claim (or purchase) school spaces, such as the cafeteria or classrooms. Other players are then charged points if they land on a place that has been claimed.

Players can also be sent to detention and can pick fights with other players to claim territory (decided by rolling the die).

The game is clearly a simplified version of Monopoly, with paper "popularity points" instead of money.

40074.description: The game consists of 12 large dice and some chips. There are rules for six games included, four of which are solitaire games. Some are reminiscent of "Rubik's Cube", just with separate dice.
40074.name: Ombagassische Würfelmagie

40075.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Blood & Steel Expansion Pack is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and is an extension of the highly successful Blood & Steel folio game on the battle of Kursk.

The Expansion Pack involves the two other pivotal battles around the Kursk salient: Oboyan Hills and Rzhavets bridgehead using the Blood & Steel game system.

Expands:

Blood & Steel
40075.name: Blood & Steel Expansion Pack

40076.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ponyri is a Blood & Steel system game designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and is an extension of the highly successful Blood & Steel folio game on the battle of Kursk.

Ponyri Station is a simulation of the armored clashes between XLI Panzer Corps and the defending Soviet forces near the small town of Ponyri, reflecting the high water mark of the German Kursk campaign.

Expands:

Blood & Steel
40076.name: Ponyri

40077.name: Jungle Life DVD game
40077.description:
Sequel to the popular "Wildlife DVD Boardgame".

The setting has moved from the Serengeti to the jungle.
The concept of the game remains the same though: Answer trivia questions related to the video fragments on the DVD. But there are a few minor changes. Up to 6 people can play now, 5 Questions must be answered each round, to determine the number of spaces you can move. 2 "Danger-plates" are added.

From the publisher's website:
In this exciting DVD board game, players help their chimpanzee make his way through a jungle full of danger. Every player has his or her own chimpanzee. Answer the trivia questions correctly and You can help save your chimpanzee and his friends' jungle home.

Jungle Life can be played with entire family and was developed in collaboration with National Geographic

40078.description:
Published in Panzer Digest #5.

Simulates the American breakout at the start of Operation: Cobra in the bocage country of France, in the month after D-Day. Americans are on the offensive, and must destroy German units and exit the map to the south; Germans are on the defensive, and must try and prevent this.
40078.name: Breakout at St. Lo

boardgameimplementation: Thunder Gods: Kamikazes Over Okinawa (Second Edition)
40079.description:
Game uses a standard deck of cards to resolve activations and combat between the Japanese planes trying to destroy US Navy ships, and the American planes and ships in defense. Simulation of kamikaze action off Okinawa in April, 1945.

Published in Panzer Digest #5
40079.name: Thunder Gods: Kamikazes at Okinawa

40080.name: My Little Ladybug
40080.description: Full title is My Little LadyBug Fly Away Home game. Players try to be the first to collect three different colored baby bug chips for their ladybug house. A plastic ladybug acts as a spinner when placed on top of each player's flower base as well as a device which shoots out the chips when her head is pressed. No reading required. Ages 3 - 6.

40081.description:
Tannhäuser Field Ops is a table top card game where the cards move on the table (like in Wings of War and Battleground) to represent various units in the 1949 Tannhäuser U-Chronic Universe where WWI never ended and the Reich has uncovered eldritch horror and the forces of the Union under President Edison are benefitting from alien technology from the Roswell UFO crash.

The player each secretly set up their orders and then play out the turn. Troops are assisted by various gear and special powers and are affected by different terrain cards on the table. Defeat the enemy troops or complete a scenario conditions to win.
40081.name: Tannhäuser Field Ops

40082.description:
Somewhere in Crete, buried under the ruins of the Palace of Knossos lay fantastic secrets hidden and trapped by the famous Labyrinth of Minos. You send in your commando squad to uncover the secrets, but find a dark winding complex of tunnels filled with enemy soldiers. You must fight or die!

Daedalus is the second expansion map for Tannhäuser. It introduces the Labyrinth of Minos where you will explore the maze made famous by the Minotaur of Minos; filled with mystery and great treasure.

Daedalus introduces several new concepts to Tannhäuser maps. Included are one way spaces, restricted spaces and 4 entry points! There is also a horizontal tram system to speed a single character's across to the opposite side of the map. There is also a series of 6 scenarios and 64 tokens featuring many of the Token of the Month entries.
40082.name: Tannhäuser: Daedalus

40083.name: Cluedo Chocolate Edition
40083.description:
Rules are similar to the classic game, but the cards are replaced by wrapped chocolates.
The first one to discover the correct character, weapon, and location wins the game. The winner has the right to divide the chocolates among the players and then the game gets eaten.

Content:
- 33 chocolates with suspects, murder weapons and rooms on the wrapper
- Paper game board
- Note pad and 4 chips and 2 dices

40084.name: The Shopping Game
40084.description:
Simple economics for children aged from 8 (although most 5 year olds can play the game well).

Move around the store buying the cheapest item of clothing (from 8 different types) but don't spend more than £25 (it is an old game!).

40085.name: Sea and Sand
40085.description:
Roll a dice to select the size (small, medium or large) tile randomly chosen from the face down pile to place on the playing board.

The tile placed must have a common edge to a tile already played and bonus points are available if the placed tile has an animal depicted.

Covering other symbols on the board also generate bonus points (so an early introduction to tactical play).

Unplayable pieces count as minus points at the end of the game.

Part of the "Let's Play" series from Crown Andrews.

40086.description:
Co-operative game playing for very young children.

From the rules:
"Paul, the Shepherd, has spent the day tending his sheep and lambs. He was helped by his dogs. As evening approached and it was time to bring the sheep and lambs into a pen for the night, Paul busied himself with putting the logs together for the pen while the dogs rounded up the sheep and lambs. It was a game they all enjoyed. The dogs hurried about trying to get the sheep and lambs into the pen before Paul could lay all the logs together to close the two entrances. See if you can help so the dogs can win again."

The players try to drive home the sheep by using their dogs. They have to achieve this before the shepherd completes a pen in the middle of the game area (which is variably set up from tiles, some of which are the sheep). The building speed is determined by the same die that also moves the dogs which can proceed to the next tile of the color that was rolled. As so often with Herder games, players can pass their die results to other players. All players win or lose together (if the pen is completed before the sheep are in).

Game play is varied by the fact that the meadow is completed by the forming of paths using 28 interlocking tiles that feature the sheep, poppies, etc. The number of tiles can be reduced to make the game easier for younger children.
40086.name: Shepherd

40087.name: Triage
40087.description:
Triage is a wonderful card game from the French publisher Grimaud who is more well known for his releases of traditional card games.
Aim of the game is to complete special trains and to score points for the best and longest of them.
This is done basically by drafting and discarding.
But what separates it from other games which are similar is a spinner with French train signals which will enhance or hinder your basic draw.
And you can steal an opponents train if you complete it using a set number of additional cards.

Game components are of the finest sort: Super illustrated cards with locos and train cars from the steam area (featuring the famous Bugatti train...) before WW II and a patented card tray with golden applications.

40088.description:
WW1 had barely ended when the Allies began to interfere with the Russian Civil War in 1918. France, eager to continue flexing its military muscle, sent troops to colonize and control the Ukraine region while disarming the German troops there. The local population welcomed them to some degree thinking the French and Greek troops were sent to liberate them from the Red menace. Armed with tanks, aircraft and armor cars, the French sent the Greeks out to remote areas to secure it. However, the Red followers had secured vast amounts of weapons from the Germans, much to the dislike of the French, and were more than eager to fight. By March 1919, the Ukraine was on fire. The French and Greek troops were greatly disliked by all Russians after their true intentions had been revealed to the general public. This further emboldened the Red forces who were outnumbering the Allies. In the coming weeks, numerous battles were fought until the last bastion at Odessa.

Game using the 'Russian Civil War Series' system.

Game components:

•One 11" x 17" map sheet depicting the terrain the battle was fought over.
• One sheet of 260 counters.
•One Players’ Aid Sheet.
•The series core rulebook that include the game rules used.
•A rulebook specific to The Ukraine on Fire.
40088.name: The Ukraine on Fire: French Debacle at Odessa 1919

40089.name: MegaMusic
40089.description:
The game mechanics is based on the one of Monopoly, but with quite a few noticeable additions. Moving around the board players may buy festival sites, build stages, trade rare recordings, hire artists, make new recordings, etc. Added inner track - so called "The wheel of fortune" adds another dimension of players' interaction to the mix: here players may release new songs, collect awards for them, making them go to top10 etc. The game money depict famous musicians like Jimmy Hendrix or Elvis Presley.
The game is accompanied with a four compact disc compilation of Polish music.

40090.name: Scene It? To Go!: Movie
40090.description:
All the fun of the original game is packed into these compact travel cases with on-screen trivia cards and dice! Magnetic game tokens make it possible to play Scene It? anytime, anywhere.

The compact travel case features real movie clips, trivia questions and on-screen challenges from Hollywood's hottest films, including Titanic, There's Something About Mary, Fargo and more!

40091.name: Monopoly: Turku
40091.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of Monopoly, this time based on the city of Turku (Swedish name Åbo), Finland.

40092.name: Hobiti
40092.description:
This card game is based on the basic of the hobbits culture and it is: Most important is to be well eaten and drink.
So in this game winner is that one that eats and drinks as much as possible – basic way of point collecting.
Game contains 108 cards of three kind – food and drinks, items, actions.
Game is played in turns and each hobbit must in take two actions in turn.
Actions are: playing, walking, lounge and farming.
on walk hobbit found the cards (draw)
on playing hobbit can play an action card (order nosh-up or soak, or make some dirty business) or play some item card.
on lounge hobbit gets one point
on farming hobbit gets 2 points but must discard on card.

40093.name: Monopoly: West Coast Eagles Football Club Charity Edition
40093.description:
An officially licenced Monopoly edition published to raise money for the Western Australian charity organisation 'Telethon'.
The streets are replaced with colour photos of the greatest players and coaches of the AFL (Australian Football League) West Coast Eagles Football Club 1989-2007.

40094.name: The Great Australian Road Trip
40094.description:
A Trivia Game about Australian people, places, wildlife and events across Australia.
Players answer trivia questions, choosing between questions marked as Easy, Medium or Hard, moving 2, 4 or 6 places respectively if they get the answers correct.
Victory is achieved by traveling to three randomly selected destinations across Australia and correctly answering a multiple choice trivia question there, plus by collecting three 'Detour' tokens along the way by achieving 'Detour' quests in their travels.
To even out the game there are 'Half & Half' cards which remove one of the wrong multiple choice answers at the destinations, and 'Speed' cards which allow you to move even if you get an answer wrong. These can be given in greater numbers to younger (or non-Australian) players.

40095.name: E, the Game of Martian Chinese Checkers
40095.description:
E, the Game of Martian Chinese Checkers (E = mc² - get it?) requires one Icehouse stash per player and a specifically laid out hex board. The board is a large hexagon, with its six sections colored to match the pyramids that will go on it - consistent with Chinese Checkers. The line of hexes that forms the border between "home" territories is multi-colored, matching the adjacent home territories. What makes E special is that it uses the natural size stackability of the Icehouse pieces to enhance Chinese Checkers significantly. For one thing, pieces must move precisely as many steps and/or jumps as they have pips (i.e. Smalls go 1; mediums, 2; larges, 3).

The major effect on play comes from the stackability.

A piece may never - not even for a step of a move - stack directly on its own color. (except as the result of a guard exchange)
If you can physically touch your piece (without shifting things about), you may move it, even if that means pieces atop it will take a free ride.
If you can't physically touch your piece, it is trapped.
You may never trap a piece in its home territory. The multicolor hexes come into play here, creating a somewhat safe zone for pieces. The center space is safe for everyone.
You may liberate a trapped piece of yours, teleport a guard (a trapping piece of yours), and violate the "never stack directly on yourself" rule by performing a guard exchange.




The game is otherwise exactly like Chinese Checkers.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

40096.name: Totem Blocks
40096.description:
Players take turns stacking wooden blocks that are cut in odd shapes. Take advantage of the irregular shapes to interlock blocks and stack them in a high tower.
From package: "Fun to play alone or with friends also taking turns. If you stack all the blocks without them falling you're top man on the TOTEM POLE."

Ages 3 and up.

40097.name: Caravaneers
40097.description:
A desert themed abstract played on a 7x7 board. Players try to move the pieces (Caravaneers) using two types of movement choices from their start position on the "North" and "West" edges of the board through the desert and safely to their Caravanserai located on either the "East" edge of the board or the "South" edge of the board. The player who has captured (collected) more Caravaneers by the end of play is the winner.

Published in GAMES Magazine March 2009 issue.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

40098.description: In a hand of Chicane, each of the Decktet cards is treated as just having one suit. For the double-suited number cards, only the top or bottom suit is active in a given hand. Players bid to determine which it will be.
40098.name: Chicane

40099.name: Wine Fluency
40099.description:
New Kickstarter for Wine Fluency - find us there!

In Wine Fluency you collaborate, compete and drink wine! The other teams try to guess what characteristics of the wine the pouring team has chosen. Everyone discusses the wine and then teams take turns choosing cards that match what they feel will best match the pouring teams decisions. Unlike many wine games, this is not a trivia game where you are asked questions; You only need to place your marker on the game board to indicate the following questions: Where is it from? What's the grape? How old is it? How high is the alcohol? Naturally, you have to guess. Whoever guesses best gets the most points for the bottle, and you play as many bottles as there are teams.

This game is a blast and wines is always great!

40100.name: Erotic Adventure
40100.description: A player draws a card and moves forward on the game board to the nearest space that matches the color on the card. The player then performs the action corresponding to the color on the body part shown on the space. The first player to reach the end wins.

40101.name: Herken de Hits
40101.description:
Players attempt to recognize very short music fragments from all periods in modern and classical music. Every game 50 songs have to be identified and written down on the scoresheet.

Comes with a CD with 495 fragments. Can be played individually or in teams.

40102.description:
Hoping to bring a decisive conclusion along the Western Front despite the mud-and misery-filled trench deadlock, German General von Falkenhayn launched an attack from which the French could not retreat, and would prove costly for them to defend. The goal of the German offensive was the historic and symbolic city of Verdun.

The German attack used new weapons such as poison gas, fighter airplanes to clear the skies of enemy observation planes, and a massive collection of artillery to devastate the defenders and obliterate the extensive French fortifications. The offensive was meant to inflict staggering casualties upon the defenders that would compel the Allies to negotiate. In the end, the Germans also suffered casualties that ran to the hundreds of thousands, making Verdun a symbol of war's inhumanity as well as tragic sacrifice.

Designed by Roger Nord, Verdun: A Generation Lost is based on the same design as his other WWI game which appeared in Against the Odds magazine #11, The Big Push: The Battle for the Somme. Verdun: A Generation Lost features a 22" by 34" map that, like The Big Push, uses squares to regulate the game's functions, 264 large counters, and approximately 20 pages of rules and charts. Rules cover artillery, defensive fire, and close assault attacks, various types of weaponry, and there are six smaller scenarios covering pivotal aspects of the battle.
40102.name: Verdun: A Generation Lost

40103.name: Samkvæmisspil Baggalúts
40103.description:
This party game is included with the Icelandic band Baggalútur's 2008 album - Nýjasta Nýtt.

The board is a simple track of 46 circles in yellow, red, green and blue, starting at Home Base and ending at Late Party. Roll a dice and move the pawn (not included, but the band suggests using coins, nuts, earrings, cuffs or very patient insects) along the track. When the player lands on a red, green or blue circle roll the dice twice and follow the rules accordingly.

The first player to Late Party wins the game.

40104.name: Galloping Bowling
40104.description: Galloping Bowling is a rather rare Bakelite collectible dice game most likely manufactured in the early 1940s by Galloping Games, Inc.. The game consists of five catalin dice with faces depicting pins with numbers representing the number of knocked down pins or a special marking such as spare (/), strike (X) or split (O). As in standard "lane bowling", the dice game is played by rolling dice twice for each frame and uses a similar scoring sheet to regulation bowling. Another game by the same publisher already included on Board Game Geek is the more available "Galloping Golf".

40105.name: Scrabble: 2007 Boston Red Sox Worlds Series Championship Edition
40105.description:
From the box: "Can you spell SWEEP? How about WORLD SERIES CHAMPIONS? America's Favorite Word Game meets New England's most celebrated sports franchise in the 2007 Boston Red Sox World Series Championship Edition of SCRABBLE. It's the same classic SCRABBLE played on a baseball diamond featuring great commemorative 2007 World Series images and stats. Baseball shaped letter tiles, some ultra fun rules and a special Red Sox World Series bonus dictionary is sure to be a grand slam!"

One of several Major League Baseball editions of Scrabble licensed and published by Sababa Toys. The most significant difference in this game is the way the board is laid out to resemble a baseball diamond, meaning the location of bonus squares is significantly different from classic Scrabble.

40106.name: John Lewis Gender Wars
40106.description: A team game where the players are divided into teams by gender. Each team gets a deck of cards with a category printed on it and five answers (words), the deck of cards for each team contains subjects that are stereotypically associated with that gender. The category is read out, the timer is started and the other team writes down up to eight answers on a pad. Once time runs out, the team writing gets one point for every word that was on the card, the other team then gets a card read to them, and after eight rounds the team with the most points win.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Desktop Published (DTP) / Print-and-Play / Postcard Game Nominee
2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Post-Napoleonic to Pre-World War 2 Era Board Wargame Nominee
40107.description:
Soviet Dawn brings Darin Leviloff’s novel States of Siege(TM) game system (introduced in VPG’s Israeli Independence) back for a much larger storytelling adventure covering the Russian Civil War from 1918 to 1921. With several enemy "Fronts" converging on Moscow, the fate of the revolution and the prestige of international communism rests on your ability to manage and resolve every crisis that the "Whites" can assail you with.

As the headlines unfold, you draw upon military and political resources to help you, or try to reorganize the Red Army for special abilities that can greatly enhance your position. Who knows? You might even capture the Imperial Gold Reserve!

Can you deal with the great crises of that time and defend the revolution? Will you withdraw from the Great War (WW1) or exercise the Bukharin Option and fight on? Can you execute the Czar in time, or will the Whites rescue him? Will you fortify Petrograd or press your offensives home? How will you deal with internal and external dissent? Play Soviet Dawn and see!

Game Components:
One 8-page, color Game Rules booklet
16 color, die-cut 5/8" mounted game pieces
12 color, die-cut 3/4" mounted game pieces
48 ‘Headline’ cards
One 11" x 17" color game map
Detailed Example of Play + Designer’s Notes

Scale: Each unit is one anti-communist Front, and each turn is a few weeks of real time.

Soviet Dawn FAQ answers common rule questions.
40107.name: Soviet Dawn
boardgamefamily: Victory Point Games States of Siege Series

40108.name: Mini World Cup Soccer
40108.description:
"The Original Board Game of International Soccer Competition"

You run an entire soccer team as they work their way through a tournament. The object is to win enough games and enough money to advance through the tournament rounds to the Champion round, and then win the final match to capture the Mini Gold Cup.

40109.name: Gotta Getta Gopher
40109.description:
Knock the gopher from his hole.
To knock them all, is your goal!

Contents:
1 Green Game Base with Transparent Game Cover, 2 Shooters, 16 Gophers and 40 Balls.

Each player has 8 gophers which are placed into holes in the game base. They then simultaneously launch balls out of the shooters aiming for the ramps beneath their opponent's gophers to knock them out from their holes. The first player to knock out all gophers wins. For advanced play, each player has a "wild" gopher with a black cap which may be placed in any hole and must be the last gopher knocked out to win.

40110.name: Who Gets It?
40110.description: Game to help with reading readiness. Players match image with words. For preschool to first grade students.

40111.name: Match
40111.description: Players match cards containing words and pictures. An educational game for 1st grade elementary students.

40112.name: Blast from the Past
40112.description:
From the box:

Which prophet was named one of the most admired men in the world? Did the Hill Cumorah Pageant start before or after the 100th anniversary of the organization of the Church? When did LDS gymnast Peter Vidmar lead the U.S. men's gymnastics team to its first-ever Olympic gold medal?

You don't need to know the exact date; just fit each event into your time line. Be the first to put your ten cards in chronological order and you win!

40113.name: Cheater's Game
40113.description:
Cheater’s Game is a simple competitive game with a straightforward goal: End the tenth round with the highest score. Your score consists of two types of points: honest points and points you have from cheater’s alliances. Honest points are completely risk-free, but they’re harder to accumulate. Cheater’s alliance points are easy to accumulate, and accumulate faster when you have many players in your alliance. However, any member of an alliance can turn the other members of the alliance in and take the alliance's points, adding them to their honest score. So the question is, “How far you trust a group of self-admitted cheaters?”

Cheater’s Game uses about five standard six-sided dice, two point trackers, a turn tracker, player score pawns, and several sets of cheater’s alliance pawns. The trackers and pawns you need to play are all available as a 284 KB PDF.

Cheater’s Game has fairly simple rules, but complex psychosocial dynamics. You could play it with children as young as 6 or 7, and use it as a tool for teaching ethical and social lessons. Cheater’s Game is appropriate for Ages 12 and up without adult supervision. A 4-player game takes about 45 minutes to play.

40114.name: Buck Fever
40114.description: Roll a die and move your hunter on the game board. Try to collect animals while dealing with various situation cards.

40115.name: Scattergories: The Card Game
40115.description: This is a combination of Scattergories and Slap Jack. When the category and first letter appears the first player to slap the "I Know" card gets to answer. Assuming it matches the category and starts with the letter the player gets to take the category or letter card, causing a new one of that type to appear. When one of the two decks runs out the game ends and the player with the most cards wins.

40116.name: Realms of War
40116.description:
Realms of War is a game of fantasy battlefields, of monsters, soldiers and magic. Players take the roles of commanders of huge armies in a game that’s never played the same way twice, even if players use the same army over and over again.

In Realms of War, cards represent units, commanders, magic, random events and terrain. The key to the game is not only getting the right cards at the right time, but playing them at the right time much like a general must recognize and take advantage of his opportunities.

Unlike other card games that represent fantasy battles, there are no contrived effects or cutesy, gamey rules. Realms of War plays like a real, epic battle with units, flanks and tactics. There are no cards to collect as Realms of War is NOT a CCG; each set contains everything you need to immediately begin fighting fantasy battles.

One of the big attractions of this game is the free, downloadable armies from several popular fantasy genres such as D&D, Warhammer, Dragonlance and coming soon - Middle Earth!

Available at http://biagamesonline.tripod.com

40118.name: Défifoo Jaune
40118.description:
The aim of the game is to be the first to get ride of all your cards.
Each player must place a higher card than the card already played. If he can't he has to pick a card from the draw pile.
Yellow cards are stronger than green cards and red cards are stronger then yellow cards
Red >> Yellow >> Green
There are three symbols:
Rock >>(breaks)>> Scissor >>(cut)>> Paper >>(wrap)>> Rock
There are also jokers cards (three colors), Skull-and-crossbones cards that can never be played, for a chance to win you must get ride of it.
There are also event cards.

40119.name: Rugged Adventures
40119.description:
Frome the website:

Rugged Adventures is a unique approach to table top miniatures gaming. It is a mixture of skirmish wargaming and roleplaying. While must you command bodies of figures as in any miniature wargame you also play at least one character represented by a miniature on the playing surface (or set to use an appropriate movie term). This Player Represented Personality or PRP is required to act in accordance with a pre-determined character design, complete with special abilities, specific quirks, personal goals and a requirement for the gamer to take on all the characteristics they find attached to their particular miniature.

It is a light hearted approach to tabletop games with a strong emphasis on fun and story-telling. The Rugged Adventures player is encouraged not to win the game but play the story. Often players are required by the GM to act up their actions or give an 'in character' verbal account of themselves. We want our players to laugh, shout, speak in silly accents and generally come away from a game having enjoyed themselves whether they won or lost.

If I had to boil the design philosophy down to the essentials: Rugged Adventures is a game for those of us who love to build models, terrain and paint lots of figures-and still want to have a fast paced and fun game that doesn’t bog down with complex detail. Think of the Pulp Genre itself, action oriented story telling where glaring holes in the plot are often an advantage, and then apply this same spirit to the table-top.

40120.name: Jeu des Touristes
40120.description: Vintage French cycling game from the 1910's with metal riders. The oldest version of the board had the games' rules printed on the board. It featured a Zeppelin on one of the corners (all the drawings in the corners were different, in fact), and a pre-Weimar Republic flag in a militarized Germany. The later version has demilitarized the German border, but not the Atlantic coast, which is still heavily armed.

40121.name: Symposion
40121.description:
"A Symposion is a Greek word meaning a Wine drinking party. These were popular in ancient Greece. Depending on the Host (Symposiarch), the emphasis of the gathering could range from purely Intellectual discussion to Hedonistic debauchery."

The players score points by hosting a Symposion. This is done by playing a set of cards and declaring whether the Symposion is intellectual, social, or hedonistic. The type of Symposion determines how points are calculated for the particular cards played.

The game ends when the deck has been gone through three times and no player has a Symposion to play. The player with the most points wins the game.

40122.name: Guelph & Ghibelline
40122.description:
"Factional Warfare within and between the City States of Northern Italy circa 1220-1380. Each player takes the role of a Faction that can be found in any given city." The five player factions are: Papalists, Imperialists, Republicans, Signorialists, and Citizenry.

The game is played on a circular track made up of 26 spaces. Each space represents a city in Northern Italy and is marked with the name of the city. Victory Tokens are earned by establishing control over cities.

"The Player with the most Victory Tokens at the end of the game wins. The game ends after 30 Rounds."

40123.name: Space Freighter
40123.description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Space Trading Theme. Deliver goods to far flung worlds for mega credits."

The players share a common deck made up of four types of cards: Goods, Worlds, Events, and Aid.

Mega Credits are earned by delivering Goods to Worlds. This is done by one World card and one or more Goods cards.

Event cards are resolved immediately when drawn. Aid cards can be discarded to avoid negative Event cards.

"The player with the most Mega Credits (MC) at the end of the game wins."

40125.name: Le Criterium des As
40125.description: French cycling game from the '50s. It contains a board (with almost 600 squares) and 7 cyclists (6 in national colors and 1 with a yellow jersey).

40126.name: Tour de Francia
40126.description: Spanish cycling game about the Tour de France produced at the end of the 1950's with artwork by Lizarraga.

40127.name: Jeu des Bicyclistes
40127.description: Old French game published in Paris with a cycling theme. The French Musée National de l'éducation has a copy of it on display.

40129.name: Bauer sucht Frau: Das Brettspiel
40129.description: Bauer sucht Frau - das Brettspiel is based on the successful German TV show "Bauer sucht Frau" in which real German farmers are looking for a partner. In the boardgame you have the same goal of finding a partner. You draw a profile card and move with your potential partner to your farm. The game is featuring trivia questions as well as communicative tasks. Whoever collected enough love markers first, will win the game and get married.

40131.description: DDR board game featuring multiple sports like cycling and gymnastics.
40131.name: Sportmagazin

40132.name: Von Drahtesel zur Rennmaschine
40132.description: Motorcycling game with simple roll & move mechanics.

40133.name: Giro d'Italia Ciclo-Automobilistico
40133.description: Double purposed Italian game from Milan published in the '60s. A simple roll and move game played with bikes or cars on the same track (Giro d'Italia). A cycling race and a car race can be played on the same board. The cycling game features three teams of two riders (whereas the car race features 6 independent cars) and the race consists of eight stages, including a time-trial. Points are awarded to the first three riders in each stage, but not all the stages award the same number of points.

40134.name: Le Tour Cycliste
40134.description: French cycling game released at the end of the '90s.

40135.name: Maglia Rosa
40135.description: Italian cycling game. The board is divided in two halves, one of which is common and the other is different for each stage. You can run several Giro stages or a Milan-San Remo. Every player chooses his favorite cyclist that's available, each with his own individual features. Some of the options are Fausto Coppi, Eddy Merckx, Bernard Hinault or Miguel Indurain. The game does not use a dice but instead an energy-keeping table and some chance cards.

40137.name: Recordman
40137.description: French game published in the '70s that combines a cycling game with geography. There was a version for 2 players only and a 4 player version published. Goal is to try to get from one city to another as fast as possible and the path is marked with pins, the board has a map of France.

40138.name: Tour de France Cycliste
40138.description: French cycling game about the Tour de France published in the 1960's in which you make your own circuit with big plastic pieces. The game also has four plastic cyclists.

40139.name: Game of Life: The Wizard of Oz
40139.description:
(From back of the box)

Travel along the Yellow Brick Road with your favorite characters from The Wizard of Oz: Dorothy, Scarecrow, Cowardly Lion and Tin Man. Experience The Wizard of Oz as you steal an apple, get caught by the Wicked Witch of the West, visit the Wizard of Oz and ultimately find your way home. Visit all of the magical locations like the poppy fields, Emerald City and Munchkinland in a quest to return to Auntie Em's Farmhouse with the most money and win the game.

40140.name: Pirate-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
40140.description: Heavily-stripped-down monopoly variant for children, box recommends Ages 5 - 8. Pirate theme.

40141.name: Obama!  The Game
40141.description:
In Obama! the game, each player is attempting to win over the United States during the election of 2008 to be Obama! There are seven state cards that vary between one and three points. To win a state card, each player must build campaigns based on four areas: political, charisma, financial, and media. When a campaign reaches the cost of the state in each of the four categories, the player wins the state. In the end of the game, the player with the most state points wins.

Additional cards include "Yes We Can" cards featuring special abilities to secretly build a campaign and steal an opponent's state, or take a major supporter from their campaign.

Each card features vibrant colors, punchy political satire, and comical illustrations. Cards include: Hill Re-Clinton Endorsement, Paylin Botches another interview, Win over Bill O'really, and the Two-Headed Stewart Colbert Media Beast!

Home Page: http://www.obamacardgame.com/

40142.name: Kingdom Quoor
40142.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Amass your Royal Warriors and rally your camp. You have been granted the honor of defending Kingdom Quoor from the vile dragon scourge and rescuing her fair maidens.

Seek the sometimes costly aid of the citizens enlist the unique talents of the friar, the assassin, the wizard, the temptress and, more.

Bid for control and plot your every move, help your cause or hinder your opponents.

The many decisions are yours.

Temper your forces before entering a lair. Slay the beasts and collect your rewards.

Tactful competition or purposeful sabotage. Race against your vile opponents to prevail.

Experience the menace and marvel of Kingdom Quoor.

40143.name: Game of 31
40143.description:
A normal deck of cards is used. All the aces through sixs are removed and placed into their appropriate stacks. Players take turns removing one card and keeping a running total of the pips. The first player to take a card that makes the running total go past 31 loses!

This is an old con man's game. Con men have spent years studying the game to get some easy money. If you are offered a game of 31 from a complete and total stranger, don't take it... you're not going to win!

40144.name: Loose Change
40144.description: Loose Change is a card game of counting money. On their turn, players add to the cards face down in the middle, trying to add up to a dollar. If you complete the dollar, you earn the cards. But be careful not to bust--- for if you do, these cards count as negative points! Whoever has the most positive piles at the end is the winner.

40145.description:
Simple French cycling game about 'Pif le Chien', published in 1960.

The players roll and move their pawns along the board using a spiral track. It's a Game of Goose like game. There are 74 spaces. Some of the spaces give players an advantage while other give a disadvantage. The first player arriving at space 74 wins the game.
40145.name: Le Tour de France de Pif

40146.name: Tour de France: Spannend Wielerronde-spel
40146.description: Dutch cycling game about the Tour de France, published during WWII.

40147.name: Peloton
40147.description: Spanish cycling game from the '90s with a reversible board, trivia cards and a peloton counter, that moves one space at a time.

40148.name: Das Monster-Spiel
40148.description: Players build monsters (consisting of six cards each) on plastic "operating tables". Whoever finishes first is the winner. Some action cards bring a bit more variation, i.e. stealing parts from other tables etc.

40149.name: Goldbärchen-Spiel
40149.description: In this game, players try to collect bear tiles with four different kinds of ribbons. The players move their playing pieces across the board and flip over the face down tile they end their move on. If they don't own the respective color yet, they get to keep it, otherwise they have to place it on the board again. Whoever collects all four colors first, wins.

40150.name: Golf
40150.description: Golf has two parts: A luck-based starting phase in which the players try do get their golf ball onto the green by rolling dice, and a dexterity phase on the green in which a mechanical golfer statue pushes the ball into the hole (for this, you have to press down the shoulders and then let go, and the golfer will hit the ball with a corresponding strength).

40151.name: Hans im Glück
40151.description: Based on a Fairy Tale (Hans im Glück) in which an allegedly naive man swaps his belongings into less and less valuable items, players try to follow a certain order of trades (gold into a horse, a horse into a cow, a cow into a pig etc.). This is done by moving over a layout of 30 face down tiles by help of a die roll. The players move to a tile, flip it over and see if it matches their needs. In the beginning, it is pure luck, later there is a memory aspect to the game.

40152.name: Hipp Hipp Hurra
40152.description: The game consists of 48 cards with 8 different, but similar faces. One is in the middle of the table. Players then take turns to flip open a card from their personal stack. The first player to discover two of the same faces calls "Hipp Hipp" and puts the two cards in front of him/her. If a player discovers three of the same (two in front of another player, one in the middle), he/she calls Hipp Hipp Hurra and wins that trio. Whoever has most trios in the end, wins.

40153.name: Im Zauberwald
40153.description: Bears move towards their home, courtesy of a color die. On the way, they are collecting magic items and have to watch out for an evil sorcerer who might turn these into useless flowers. Luck-based game for smaller kids.

40154.name: "Erst sehen - dann gehen!"
40154.description:
Each player moves one of his/her four meeples toward a meeting point while paying attention to the traffic signs on the way. Afterward, there is an intermediate game phase where the players need to sort some cards by their numbers. Finally, the meeples have to return home, again watching for the traffic signs.
The game is obviously designed to let children learn the traffic signs.

40155.name: Familie Mayer
40155.description: Collection of four luck-based games around a family doing various kinds of sports. In the "main game", each player has several cards of one family member and has to get complete families doing the same sport by asking other players about their hand cards, much like in the German classic "Quartett".

40156.name: Filou
40156.description: This is a memory game in which players move around a board which contains twelve face down chips (four sets of three each). Each time a meeple steps onto a square, the player shows the other side and places it onto the square he or she came from. The memory layout thus changes constantly. If a player knows the location of a complete set, he or she calls it (and gets the set if he or she is correct). New chips are placed and a new turn starts. Whoever collects 15 chips first, wins.

40157.name: Flieg, kleiner Schmetterling!
