The 2 inch set features 4 pairs of bowls, each pair with a different bias. Jack is 1.25 inches diameter.
The bowls in the 2 1/4 inch set all have the same bias. Jack is 1.5 inches diameter.

boardgamecompilation: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #2
40264.description:
The Trains is a small expansion for Aquaretto consisting of 18 tiles which have either one of four different-colored trains or curves. These are mixed in with the other tiles and taken off trucks just like those tiles.

The trains are added to any empty space in your zoo and each different type of train (the four colors and the curve) in your zoo scores 2 points and each type in your depot scores minus two points at the end of the game.

This expansion was part of the second collection of mini-expansions sold by Rio Grande for Zooloretto, which also included Zooloretto: Job Boards, Zooloretto: The Gorilla, Zooloretto: The Savings Book, and Aquaretto: Three Coworker Tiles.

Also available as part of the Zooloretto: Goodie-Box.
40264.name: Aquaretto: The Trains

40265.name: Playing Gods: Expansion Pack
40265.description:
For Playing Gods players who wish to delve deep into the well of blasphemy (or just want to see deluxe cards with full-color images of the gods), here's an Expansion Pack with 30 deluxe cards specific to the five major religions. They provide special attacks and defenses based on each religion's characteristics, and are easily incorporated into the existing rules and card decks. You can even create your own attacks!

Includes:
- 30 new cards
- 5 blank cards

Expands:

Playing Gods: The Board Game of Divine Domination

40266.name: Tri-Casa
40266.description:
Tri-Casa is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for family and friends. If you like Rummy and Mille Bornes, you'll love Tri-Casa. This game is sure to be a hit with your family on vacations, camp outs, or an evening at home. English and Spanish instructions are included.

Similar to the play in Rummy, players receive seven cards to begin and draw from the deck or discard pile to begin each turn. Player discards one card to signal the end of the turn. The object of the game is to collect groups of three houses of the same color or three houses at consecutive addresses on the same street. Players lay down collections to gain the 10 points on each of the cards. A player can match a fixer-upper house with a cash card for 25 points. There is an old fire station card and an old church card that can be played alone and worth 25 points each.

Like Mille Bornes, this game has a few roadblocks. A player can play a Haunted House card or a Termite card on an opponent. The opponent cannot lay down any point cards until the proper remedy card is played, which is a Medium or Exterminator. If the player has the Home Inspection Team card displayed, the player is exempt from Termite or Ghost troubles.

Hands end when a player runs out of cards. Don't get caught with a lot of points in your hand, as they are subtracted from the points you have collected on the table. Play continues until a player reaches 500 points.

Learn more at www.tricasagame.com.

40267.name: SESSION 'Bottlecap' Rock Paper Scissor GAME
40267.description:
Using SESSION 'bottlecaps' having inner depictions with 2 kinds of each for these with a total of 6 now, then you can PLAY out "Rock, Paper, Scissor" games. Each participant shall utilize ONE complete 'Set' of "RPS" 'bottlecaps' for these during their PLAY, or in the case with "Solitaire" then ALL for that lone player.

"Solitaire" Method: Place ALL of those face-down and then pick 2.

"Fog of War" Method: Place ALL 3 of them in your HAND and then each player picks 1 to display their selection.

"Blind Pick" Method: Place ALL of them face-down and then each player selects theirs for comparison.

"Down Under Wonder" Method: Place your 3 'bottlecaps' in your hand with that behind you, then choose one randomly and whip it out!

40268.description:
Mälumängu Doomino (Trivia Dominoes) is a boardgame that puts a trivia element into the well known dominoes game. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles

The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, science, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and varia
40268.name: Mälumängudoomino

40269.name: Toby
40269.description:
Players begin the game with a Gold, entry level Credit Card and Cash as they journey around the gameboard leveraging on both Cash & Credit to win.

The Goal: To get your Black Card, acquire $2,500 Cash and have $0 worth of Debt.

boardgameimplementation: Call of Cthulhu: Collectible Card Game
boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
40270.description:
"The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.¨
- H.P. Lovecraft, Supernatural Horror in Literature

Welcome to the world of the Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, a world based on the weird fiction of H.P. Lovecraft and his literary circle. In this world, conflicts rage between cosmic powers who want the world for their own unfathomable purposes and the human agencies dedicated to stopping them.

The weird world of H.P. Lovecraft's Cthulhu Mythos has drawn in fans for more than eighty years, with its richly painted themes of suspense, adventure, and the eerie unknown. Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game is fully immersed in this world and what is more, places you, as a player, in control of some of the facets of that world.

A typical game of Call of Cthulhu plays very quickly between two players and it has a high-level of player interaction, analysis of open information, planning and strategy. There is a wide variety of possible combinations of factions (Syndicate with Agency, Cthulhu with Hastur, etc.) and each combination will necessitate a different, challenging approach, providing high levels of re-playability.

One of the major appeals of the Living Card Game® format is that it gives you not only a solid game experience, full of strategy and excitement, but it also allows you to customize your gaming experience to your liking. As you customize your deck from the Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game card pool, you get to build a strategy around your personal play style.

This game was originally a CCG, having been transitioned to Fantasy Flight Games' new Living Card Game (LCG) format. Monthly Asylum Pack expansions to the card pool were eventually supplanted by larger quarterly(-ish) expansion boxes.

FFG ended development and organized play support for the game in 2015. "That is not dead which can eternal lie, and with strange aeons, even death may die."

Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Just the Two of Us” Episode 8

40271.name: Teta Fuhu
40271.description:
Two or more players draw a small base of circles in their corner of a paper. Each player stands their pencil on its end and slides it across the paper. A new circle is drawn where the line ended, but the previous circle stays in place.

If another player's circle is hit, then that circle is scribbled out. Then, the "shooting" player takes another turn. A player wins when all circles of other colors have been scribbled out.

Many variants allow for wall-like obstacles where circles stop or pits where if a line crosses it, that circle does not count.

40272.description:
Cirkle Mind is a must play board game.The strategy is based on your ability to memorize the shapes and the colors of the players' pieces, which are not shown to your opponent.
The Strategy of the movements, by associating the forms and the colors of the pawns, is vital.
Goal of the game: to find the target (top piece) of the other player among 24 figurines (which have different colors and forms). To capture the units and to control the best spaces on the board. The combat system is similar to Stratego. Beware: the black piece is the strongest one and if your pawn match shape and colour on the board, it gets a high defense value.
Another board game connected to the Cirkle Series.
40272.name: Cirkle Mind

40273.description:
Abstract board game introducing the terrain concept:the board position decide how your piece will move,according to the CIRKLE gaming concept .
Aim of the game is to capture the opponent pawns, upgrade to draughts (2 pieces) or tower (3 pieces) and occupying the 2 targets squares on the board. Games options available.
Ages 6 and up, 25 minutes playing time.
40273.name: CirKle WOM

40274.name: Pokémon Board Game Book
40274.description:
Two players (or two teams) compete over four track-boards. Track-boards are "customized" by one or two of the six double-sided Pokémon cards, each of which has a 7x8 grid of characteristics/activities of which about 15 show through cut-out windows in each track-board.

Each player controls three white tokens which move along the track as a result of a spinner, plus a coloured token that moves as a result of combat results. Points are scored by combat results, or by completing track-boards. Win by reaching 260 points, or by reducing your opponent to 0 (everyone starts at 130 points).

By careful choice of placement of the white tokens, players can focus on offence, defence, or movement along the track-board.

40275.name: Merchant Princes
40275.description:
Concept: Merchants in the ancient empire of Byzantium (circa 7th century) attempt to accumulate, trade, bribe, cheat and manipulate their way to becoming the richest Merchant Prince in the land.
Summary: Assuming the role of one of four wealthy merchants in Constantinople, players develop a trading empire across Anatolia, buying goods in far off markets to sell in the city, while doing their utmost to undermine and obstruct their rivals. Players use Trader pawns to amass goods appearing across the board, avoiding dangerous local events and rival player skulduggery to bring the goods to the great bazaars. The player with the biggest merchant empire at game end is crowned the Merchant Prince of Byzantium. The game plays across a main geographical board with each player having a player board for storage of trade goods, special tiles, money etc. Stocks of Event and Option cards give each game complexity, depth and variation.
Status: Game is currently being play tested and rules further modified.

40276.description:
From the back of the box:

Venice, the 1400's. You are a young merchant trying to make your name in this legendary port of vibrant commerce. Trade in spices, silks, gems, iron, and grain can bring great wealth... if you can bend the market to your will. Buy goods as they enter the city docks and sell them to the tradesmen who need them. Increase your profits by buying shares of the shops that use the goods in which you trade. Gain gold and prestige by fulfilling the orders of the Guild Hall craftsmen.

But Venice is a city of fickle demands and mercurial politics. Spend your ducats wisely and look for help from powerful people such as the Guildmaster, the Harbormaster, the Tax Collector... or perhaps a Thief. Even the humble Gondolieri have powerful connections in Venice. In the end, the most important thing to remember is the simple rule of commerce... buy low and sell high! Only those with the most gold and the highest prestige can truly become... Masters of Venice!
40276.name: Masters of Venice
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 33 – Masters of Venice
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50

40277.name: Monopoly: Amiens
40277.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Amiens, in France.

40299.name: Taistelurekka
40299.description:
From the box cover: "Taistelu Rekka - adventure game of the future"

The game takes place in the USA in 2032. The population has centered to seven metropolises. Players are truck drivers trying to earn money by transporting goods from city to city, through the dangerous deserts where battles with bandits can be fatal.

The first player to save enough money to buy out his truck is the winner.

The name of this Finnish game is "Battle Truck" in English.

When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Strasbourg, in France.

40344.name: Sheng Guan Tu
40344.description:
Sheng Guan Tu means "Promotion Official Chart" in English. It is a classic Chinese game similar to Snakes and Ladders or Kang Le Qi. The game is allegedly from the Ming dynasty and was created by the calligrapher Ni Yuan-Lu. The game plays with a top that is similar to a Teetotum or Jewish Dreidel. The person who reaches the last promotion wins.

Promotion games such as this one and Hor Lor Boon were very popular in ancient China. Parents often encourage their children to play promotion games, hoping that the games would stimulate the children to work hard on the track to officialdom.

During the Cultural Revolution, the game was banned and has since been out of print.

40345.name: WWE Undisputed The Board Game
40345.description:
WWE Undisputed The Board Game allows players to take on the role of one of WWE top Wrestling Superstars, Triple H, Kurt Angle, The Undertaker or Hulk Hogan.

Players take turns moving their Superstar around the board until they collect cards that they can use later in the game. When a Superstar lands on a Match Fight space the player may challenge any other player to a Wrestling Match, preferably a player who holds a Championship Belt (Harcore, European, Intercontinental & World Heavyweight). The Wrestlers Fight by putting their Superstars in the ring in the middle of the board and playing Grapple Cards.

The objective of the game is to win all four Championship Belts.

40347.description:
From the box:
The world's number 1 game has gone global! Millions of people from all over the world voted for their greatest cities so now everyone, no matter where they live, can play the MONOPOLY game on a global scale.

Travel around the world's greatest cities, wheeling and dealing in millions of MONOPOLY dollars. As you travel, build house and hotels inspired by buildings from across the world - from mud huts to skyscrapers.

Discover which cities were voted the greatest by the world! As you play, discover interesting facts about the world on the Chance and Community chest cards... do you know which country has the most biycycles or what the most expensive work of art ever created is?

There are 24 movers from around the world - each box contains six chosen at random. Uses an electronic banking unit with cards not cash and a deal button for faster play!
boardgameversion: Parker Brothers Electronic Banking Unit edition
40347.name: Monopoly: Here and Now – The World Edition
videogamebg: Monopoly Here & Now: The World Edition

40348.name: Mulligan
40348.description:
From the rules:
Mulligan - the mind game to challenge your golf skills.

Mulligan is a game where you can acquire knowledge about the rules of golf, the history of golf and about golf technique. Mulligan has been designed like a proper golf course, consisting of 9 holes (alternatively 18 holes by playing 9 holes twice). The holes are of different length and difficulty. At each hole you get information of par and distance of the hole, as you find it on any real golf course. Mulligan is an entertaining knowledge game giving the players a good opportunity to learn or freshen up on the rules of golf and etiquette.

During the play the players will encounter all the elements that they find during a real round of golf, like bunkers, out of bounds and water hazards.

Quick description:
A challenging golf trivia game that comes with golf course board, score cards, golf ball die, tees, and trivia cards all in a wooden display box. The also game comes with rules to complete using the Stableford system, stroke play, and match play.

40349.name: Boa Viagem
40349.description:
Boa Viagem (Portuguese for "Have a Nice Trip"): A trip around the world in a funny competition game.

At the start of the game, each player receives a card with the destinations they have to visit in the game. Players must start at Iberian Peninsula and travel around the world collecting souvenirs of the indicated destinations received in their initial card.

Players have to plan their routes using roads, boats and plains paying attention to their money to avoiding spending all their money and consequently loose the game.

The player that will win is the first player who visit all the destinations of his card and return to the starting point.

40350.name: XLR8
boardgamepublisher: The United States Playing Card Company
40350.description:
From publisher http://www.drtoy.com/awards/product.php?ProductID=6158 :

XLR8™ is an exciting, math-based card game where the first player to reach 200 miles per hour wins! It is easy to learn and fun for the whole family! Each player is dealt 5 cards and the remaining cards are placed face down in the center of the table to be used as the draw pile. Players should maintain 5 cards in their hand at all times until they hit “Top Speed.” Players do this by drawing after each turn. At the end of their turn, players must call out their current speed. To start the game, players place a card from their hand on the playing surface in front of them, face up. This is the “Speed Pile.” Players have their own active speed piles they are trying to increase to 200MPH. Players track their speed using their “Speed-O-Meter” by adjusting the wheel at the end of each turn. This process is repeated until someone reaches “Top Speed,” but players must try to avoid the Blow Out, Caution, and Pit Stop cards along the way! Start your engines, you are ready to play!

40352.description:
What do the pears cost?
Do I still have enough money for tomatoes?
The most skillful shopper goes home first with a full shopping bag.
In this game children are introduced to shopping. They practice handling goods and money, learn to compare prices and take important steps towards their independence.

Children must be able to count to four and compare numbers.

Each player receives a shopping list showing 4 different goods and a purse with maximal 8 coins. In turns, players throw a dice yielding a number between 2 and 4, and move on ways between a common home, the bank and the four shops. The home is the starting place, the shops allow purchases and the bank allows to refill the purse. The first player to return home with all 4 goods on his shopping list purchased wins. Very simple.

There are 9 different shopping goods: 3 meat products, 3 bakery products and 3 fruit/vegetable products. There are four copies of each product in the game. The butcher/bakery/greengrocery hold three copies of each meat/bakery/veggie product respectively and one copy of each product is found at the delicatessen shop.

Out of its stock of 9 goods per shop, only three are on display and up for sale at a time. Goods cost between 1 and 3 coins each, depending on its display slot, clearly marked by a price tag showing coins above each good. Upon purchase, all remaining goods a shifted to the left (the cheap places) and new goods from the stock fill up the empty expensive places on the right.

This may sound more complicated than it is: a three year old easily understands it and can execute the simple mechanic, thanks to arrows and price tags showing coins and not numbers. What a three year old that is yet unfamiliar with boardgames might not immediately appreciate, is the neat balancing behind the mechanic: unsold products decrease in price, whereas sought-after products increase in price; that buying bread at the delicatessen is more expensive than at the bakery, both in terms of money and distance to travel, but that the delicatessen may save travel between different shops, etc. However, learning this by playing is the hidden educational goal of the game.
40352.name: Wir spielen Einkaufen

40353.name: Oil Well
40353.description:
OIL WELL from the Bemus Game Company, 641 Gracelawn Ave. Flint, Michigan.

From the Box: Drill for Black Gold, Be a Texas Millionaire, A Game of fun for young and old. Has an outer ring resembling Monopoly and an inner area with Roads and Properties with well sites. Landing on the appropriate areas on the outer ring allows you to drill on the well sites in the inner area.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Jogo do Ano
2009 Jogo do Ano Nominee
2010 Golden Geek Best Wargame Nominee
2010 JoTa Best Wargame Nominee
2011 Juego del Año Tico Nominee
40354.description:
MARIA is a game based on the War of the Austrian Succession, where Austria was attacked by Prussia, France, Bavaria and Saxony, while only Great Britain, Hanover and the Netherlands (by forming the so-called Pragmatic Army) helped her.

MARIA is primarily a 3 player game. One player is Austria, the second is France plus Bavaria, while the third player plays as Prussia (Austria's enemy) and the Pragmatic Army (Austria's ally) at the same time. This is made possible by the division of the map into two parts, the Flanders map and the Bohemia map.

MARIA is derived from the award-winning Friedrich, but has its very own character, including politics, hussars, force marches, imperial election, Saxony's betrayal and Prussia's annexation of Silesia. Subtle maneuvers, seizure of fortresses, prudent retreats, and Machiavellian politics are the keys to victory. However, players must be careful: whoever uses his Tactical Cards unwisely in battle can suddenly find himself not on the highway to glory but on the road to ruin.

MARIA takes you to the era of the 18th century's ruthless struggle for power. It can be played in 2 variants: the shorter, simplified introductory game or the longer but richer advanced game, with its simultaneous campaigns in Bohemia and Flanders.
40354.name: Maria
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
I've Been Diced! episode 31: Three player games
I've Been Diced! episode 66: Combat systems

40355.description:
This is a set of 48 event cards for The Sword and the Flame miniatures game, 30 of which are unique. There are events for the British side as well as "Natives". Some of the cards are titled "Universal Misery" and contain events affecting both sides. The cards cover reinforcements and low ammunition, but also include more exotic occurrences.

A sheet explaining the use of the cards in a game is included.
40355.name: The Sword and the Flame Event Deck

40356.name: Las Vegas
40356.description:
Las Vegas is a luck based game of betting and tile placement. The game consists of a board with two spinners a betting field for each player and a central board for placing your coulored chips. Initially you place your bet on your betting field. The first player then proceeds to spin both spinners. From the first he gets a colour and a number from the second just a number. The player now has the option to place his chip on one of the two numbered fields he spun inside the spinned colours area.
The aim is to be the first player to connect four in a row (horizontally, vertically or diagonal). This will net you 5 times your bet. If you have 3 in a row you get double all others loses the wagered amount. Then a new round starts.
There are more additional rules for what happens if no 4 in a row can possibly be placed and for 500.- you can buy a dice roll which creates an additional number. Furthermore you can get jokers from spinning/dice rolling which allow free selection of the placing field.
The game ends after 4 rounds of chip placement or after a set amount of cash has been earned what ever you decide at the beginning.

40357.name: Pursuit
40357.description: The game is manufactured by Are-Jay Game Co. Inc., Cleveland, Ohio. It comes with a wooden board that is attached to the box along with pegs and a die. For 2, 3 or 4 players. I could find no date for the game.

40358.description: American cycling themed racing game. Each player has his own track and he who reaches the end first is the winner. No dice are used though, movement is determined by a set of seven race cards for each player.
40358.name: Pluto Bike Racing Game

40359.name: La Grande Boucle 1954
40359.description: Small French game published in July 1954 about the Tour de France. The game works with dice but strangely enough the players get rewarded for throwing low numbers.

40361.name: Quests of the Librarian
40361.description:
Each player takes the role of the Librarian. Players try to retrieve precious artifacts to expand the Library Collection. Based on the 'Librarian' Series of Movies.

The game uses two custom card decks, an Action Deck and an Artifact Deck as well as a six-sided die for determining Initiative each round and the number of Fate cards drawn from the Action deck.

The Action Deck is composed of 80 cards divided into 8 suits of 10 cards. The suits are Knowledge, Danger, Travel, Companion, Escape, Foe, Puzzle, and Location.

The Artifact Deck is composed of 27 cards, each of which grants a special ability to the player controlling it. Artifact cards are acquired by playing melds of Action cards.

The game is won by collecting a certain number of Artifacts. The players choose the game length prior to play - from a "Short Game" (3 Artifacts) to a "Full Game" (9 Artifacts).

Basic game play is for an Artifact and a number of actions (Fate cards) to be displayed. Players collect action cards into their hand attempting to collect a meld of 8 different suites in order to claim the artifact. If no player can claim the Artifact, it remains in play for the next round.

Artifacts currently in player control and optionally disposed of action cards can be used to modify the flow of the game.

40362.name: Wonder Woman Justice League of America Game
40362.description: Features: Aquaman, Batman, Flash, Superman, Green Lantern, and Jonn Jonzz Super Hero cards along with Wonderwoman in a simple roll and move game from Hasbro.

40363.name: ADDO
40363.description: ADDO is a Bingo variant where the "banker" draws chits containing sums (from 0 + 0 to 9 + 9) and calls out the two numbers. The players then check to see if they have the answer printed on their card. The first player to cover all 9 numbers on his/her card wins.

40364.description:
Players move around a market and pick up cards with various foodstuffs. They have to collect seven different types of food in order to win.
There are also rules for some other game ideas included.
40364.name: Lirum Larum Essenspiel

40365.name: Lustiges Schrobenhausener Spargelstechen
40365.description: Two players start at opposing ends of the game board, which is made from wood and depicts an asparagus field which contains little wooden asparagus. The players now roll dice and move along certain tracks, in opposing directions (without getting into each others way), following instructions on certain fields or just harvesting the asparagus. When one player reaches his or her destination, the player with most asparagus wins.

40366.name: Beezi
40366.description:
Beezi: The S-P-E-L-L-I-N-G Game

This spelling game uses a special six-sided die with different bees on it - Stinger, Queen Bee, Honey Bee, Bumble Bee, Digger Bee, Killer Bee. On a player's turn, the die is rolled and depending on the bee that appears, the player draws a card (different bees have different degrees of difficulty) with a word to spell on it. The card is passed to the player on the left, who acts as Beekeeper and says the word on the card. All other players try to spell the word on their writing pad. If the player whose turn it is spells it correctly the player gets the indicated number of beez which are then placed on a honeycomb board; if that player misspells the word, the other players who spelled the word correctly get a beez, Rolling the Stinger causes a missed turn, and the Queen Bee gives the opportunity to earn double the number of beez.

40367.name: L'Anniversaire des triplés
40367.description: In this game; you attempt to fill your birthday cake appropriately by rolling the dice and playing cards. The special dice allow you to advance by the number of faces you see with two boys and a girl showing allowing you to advance six. What is neat is you can use your own birthday month as the chance to score a candle. Great bits make this a relatively interesting game.

40368.description:
From the publisher:

The children find a magic suitcase, hidden in an old attic and they are eager to discover what they can do with it . Their surprise is enormous when they find that they can pack anything they want in it. They have a great idea for a game. Pack the bag, with plenty of room for imagination. Who will be the first to pack all their things into the suitcase?
8 Cards with a question mark allow the players to put in what ever they want.

Tin box game from HABA

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>
40368.name: Kofferpacken
boardgamefamily: HABA Game in a Tin series

40369.name: Hell's Kitchen: The Board Game
40369.description:
Welcome to Hell's Kitchen, where the chef's word is law. As the latest trainees in the kitchen, you have a full day ahead of you. It's not simply a matter of serving cool culinary creations, there's a lot of hard work first. The day starts with preparing the ingredients for today's menu. Only then can you start cooking - and you'd better have everything ready by the time service starts. And meet chef's standards.

In the game, players prepare ingredients according to the recipes for the dishes they're cooking. They can take advantage of the ingredients other players prepare to get their dish ready quickly. Then it's time for service and we find out who's got it right - and whose dishes are going in the bin. Remember: if you can't take the heat, stay out of Hell's Kitchen!

Similar to Mamma Mia!, but now with a new theme and some new rules.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
40370.description:
Islas Canarias is a game about the settlement of the Canary Islands.

The players draw 3 settler cards from the stock or choose one from their hand to build a house on their island. The color is given by the card and the player must choose a place on the island for it responding to priorities of the played settler card. For example: 1st priority for the new building is a place near the river, 2nd priority near a red building, 3rd priority near the coast and the 4th priority near a brown building. The player must build the house following this priorities.

The second action of his turn is to put a settler card on the table. This card belongs to the ship.
After every player has done his 2 actions the ship arrives and those cards are played. The building of a card gets the player who fulfills the (highest possible) priority best.
After the ship phase a next turn starts.

The player can change 2 or 3 houses in more valuable buildings and can get privilege cards for being the best in one building color.

At the end of the game the player with the most points for the buildings wins.
40370.name: Islas Canarias

40371.name: Mathador
40371.description:
Mathador is a mathematical educational game.

You move trough the board answering arithmetic questions and resolving mathematical quizzes.

Home Page: http://www.mathador.fr/ (French)

40372.name: Mathador Junior
40372.description:
Mathador Junior is a mathematical educational game, a Junior version from the original Mathador Game.

You move trough the board answering arithmetic questions and resolving mathematical quizzes.

40373.name: Mathador Kid
40373.description:
Mathador Kids is a mathematical educational game from the designer of Mathador.

It consists of 25 little games played with large dice which involve mathematical operations.

40374.name: Instant Thunder
40374.description:
Fast play air-to-air combat miniatures game for jets equipped with guns and missiles. The game uses a rectangular grid with playing card suits marking 4 rows and cards K to A marking 14 columns, similar to Gary Graber's Göring's War.

Jets have individual flight characteristics for vertical and lateral movement, as well as armament and structural points.

Each turn a card is drawn for each jet to place it onto the grid on the appropriate space. Jets may be able to move to a different space by drawing a new card that must be lower than its movement rating. Thereafter shooting cannon fire and missiles is preformed in a similar fashion. At the end of each turn, the jets are removed from the grid, so may reappear on an entirely new angle of attack the following turn.

Rules provide many optional rules and complete aircraft statistics for any period from the Korean War to present.

A short introduction to the rules, focusing on the Vietnam era, is available in Wargames Illustrated No. 254 (December 2008), under the name "Very Instant Thunder".

40375.description:
Re plays like chess without moving your pawns!
Every player starts with 10 chessmen. At your move you can place one of your chessmen on the board or you can move one. But you may only move if you can hit another pawn.
When both player passed consecutively the game ends. Now every player gets points for the remaining chessmen on the board. The player with the higher count wins.

This game was published as Spielbox Edition No.8 in Spielbox issue 2/1994.
40375.name: Re

40376.name: Crazy Chefs
40376.description: Join the chefs in the crazy kitchen and collect everything they need to make a meal. Then grab your plate and wait for your dish to cook! Will you be the first to serve up a tasty treat? A fun lotto game with a food.

40377.name: Damix
40377.description:
DAMIX is an innovative game based on observation, tactics and moving in a 3 dimensions environment based on a territory of 6 sides of different colors.

Goal of the game : The Goal for each player is to choose 1 color and to transfer the pawns to the opposite side of the cube as fast as possible.

The winner is the player or the players who in the same round has located all the pawns on the opposite side of the same color in a cross pattern.

FAST GAME : the winner is the first player who locate the 8 pawns in his territory (16 possible patterns).

Game Advise : Do not let one pawn standing alone as each move will cost one round…

One player game : The target of the game is to bring the pawns to the opposite side with a minimum of moves.
Sudoku Colors play option available .

40378.description:
A follow on to Total Axis Pack I: Eastern Front Firestorm.

While the pack features the typical set of German, Russian, American and Minor power forces, Scenarios TAP 21 and 22 feature the Italians vs. the Japanese in Peking and Tientsin China in September 1943.

Scenario pack contents:

12 scenarios - TAP 13-24
Map board - 32x9 hex map named TXP1
Special Rules
Cover/Title sheet
Informational back sheet.




This scenario pack is not a complete game. Beyond Valor and Armies of Oblivion are required to play this games as Total Axis Pack I and geomorphic boards 19, 42, 10 21, 23, 45, 46, 51, and Deluxe A. Ownership of Jatkosota: Finland at War is suggested.
40378.name: Total Axis Pack II

40379.name: Fun with Rhymes
40379.description: Recognize, identify, and match rhyming endings in three different educational games played on the same game board.

40380.name: The Classification Game
40380.description: Contains illustrations that fit into various groupings. Gameplay can be expanded to include an entire classroom or smaller groups as players fit their items into logical groupings to encourage the development of organizational and classification skills.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
40381.description:
In Masters Gallery, players are art critics and gallery owners at the same time, trying to pump up the value of certain artists before cashing in their works. The works of five artists – Vermeer, Degas, Renoir, Monet and Van Gogh – are in play. Each player starts with a hand of masterpiece cards, and on a turn you play one on the table to show a stake in the fate of that artist; some masterpiece cards include special actions that allow you to play a second card, draw an extra card, increase the value of a certain artist, or have everyone play a masterpiece card at once.

When a certain number of works from one artist are on the table, the round ends, and each work from the most well-represented artists are sold for $1-3. Masters Gallery lasts four rounds, with players receiving additional masterpiece cards prior to new rounds and the value of an artist's work increasing based on past performance. The player with the most money after four rounds wins.

Masters Gallery depicts classic works of art on its cards; Modern Art: The Card Game, which features identical game play, uses "modern art" along the lines used in designer Reiner Knizia's Modern Art board game.
40381.name: Masters Gallery
videogamebg: Reiner Knizia's Modern Art: The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 7 12/29/2014 - 1/4/2015

40382.description:
Scenario Pack Contents

8 scenarios
Cover Sheet
Back informational sheet




7 European and one Pacific theater scenarios. These are older out of print Critical Hit scenarios that have been reworked and updated. Critical hit says that this is first of a series of reworked, updated and renamed scenario packs.

One of the scenarios is Guadalcanal, another early war, eastern front 1941. The rest are mid-late war. All of the scenarios even the Guadalcanal one feature tanks, and several of the scenarios feature well known and/or heavy tanks, the Panther, Tigers, Tiger IIs, JgPz V, SU-152, JgdPz V, ISU-122, and the Joseph Stalin II.

As with all scenario packs this is not a complete game, Ownership of Beyond Valor, Yanks, Gung Ho, Code of Bushido as well as Geomorphic boards 2,6,9,17,37,41,42, 44,46,47,48,49 is required.
40382.name: Retro Pak I

40383.description: Euro-Pack II: The Battle of the Bulge is a set of eight scenarios designed for the ASL (Advanced Squad Leader) system. Set includes Euro-Pack scenarios #62, 12, 52, 54, 53, 45, 10 and 20. Scenario directions are done in the standard ASL style, printed on heavy cardstock in black, gray (German) and green (American). Critical Hit describes this set as follows: "In a strange twist of corporate logic the gang at Critical Hit decided to present you an interesting set of scenarios depicting Bulge actions in Belgium, fought over places like Ligneuville, Cour, and Thirimont designed by...yes, Belgians! Not your ordinary Belgians, but the kind that walk battlefields and pore over every minute detail of the engagements." Like most ASL scenario packs, this is not a complete game and requires ownership of the necessary counters from other sources. Playing the scenarios also requires ownership of standard ASL mapboards/mapsheets N#1, 40, 18, 12, 24, St., 17, 19, 4, 41, 16, 18, 9, 18, 13 and 4.
40383.name: Euro-Pack II: The Battle of the Bulge
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge

40384.name: Paduk
40384.description: Paduk is a traditional game of Korean origin usually played on the specially marked inner 9 by 9 grid of the Go board. Players own two sorts of pieces, called stones (round) and columns (square). The stones are able to move, the columns stay on their places, until a player breaks the game, then all columns of this player go to the hand of this player for new placing. A player is not allowed to break the game twice, the hostile side must break the game also. Object of the game is to form geometrical positions of four on the board, which are formed of the two sorts of pieces. After the first move Paduk offers more movement possibilities than Go and clearly more than Chess.

40385.name: The Bulge
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge
40385.description:
This is a re-design/re-development of SPI's Bulge (1979) (subsequently rereleased as The Big Red One in 1980).

In addition to updating the rules, this version introduces new victory conditions, a shorter play time, and updated art on the 34"x22" map and 176 5/8" counters. The original counter set has been expanded and now offers players the choice of using either "classic" NATO symbology or a more modern iconic style.

40386.description:
Disney Club Penguin Trading Card Game, known as Card-Jitsu, is one of the children's games available in the Club Penguin online community. The online version of the game has a similar rules to the physical card game.

There are two rule sets: Quick Game Rules and Standard Game Rules. Quick Game Rules is basically rock-paper-scissors with cards (water beats fire, fire beats snow, snow beats water). Each card has a numeric value from 1 to 12, which is used to resolve winners when the symbol is the same. The player who wins the most battles, wins the game.

Under the Standard Game Rules, each player starts with a deck of 20 or more cards. The decks are shuffled and players maintain 5 cards in their hand. Combat can now be affected by special powers on some of the cards (for instance, "fire cards become snow for this round"). The winner is the first player to collect either a set of the three cards with the same symbol and with different number colors or a set of three cards with different symbols and different number colors.
40386.name: Disney Club Penguin Trading Card Game

40387.description:
At the Essen Game Fair of 2008, Lookout Games had a special 12 card Special Building promo pack for their new game, Le Havre.

After the Fair, Hanno of Lookout Games held a charity auction for the expansion for those who could not attend the Essen Game Fair.

The set includes:





Nr

English

Deutsch



00

Dunny

Toilettenhäuschen



036

Worker's Cottages

Arbeitersiedlung



037

Construction Site

Baustelle



038

Logging Camp

Holzfällerlager



039

MS Dagmar

MS Dagmar



040

Pawnbroker's

Pfandleihe



041

Pirate's Lair

Piratennest



042

Junkyard

Schrottplatz



043

Dive Bar

Spelunke



044

Picket Line

Streikposten



045

Tobacco Factory

Tabakmanufaktur



046

Cattle Drive

Viehtrieb





Expands:

Le Havre
40387.name: Le Havre Expansion: Essen Promo Cards

40388.name: Dictator. Control
40388.description: Dictator. Control - is a Russian collectible strategy game. Game has deep atmosphere of dark future. There are two factions - Order of New Tampliers and Simbiotic Sinclit and independent Mercenaries. Player must fight with other players and conquer energy fabrics. Game has simple rules and interesting gameplay.

40389.name: Penny Push
40389.description:
Penny Push Game

A very simple but enjoyable game that combines
basic physical agility and strategy.

Use 6 pennies or dimes on a smooth tabletop (great for playing at a cafe).

Each player on opposite sides of the table places
3 coins on the table in a triangle, approx. 3 inches
apart (one player can be heads and the other
tails).

Each player takes turns flicking a coin with his
finger so that it passes in between his other two
coins, thus moving his triangle step by step
across the table.

No coin can be moved twice in a row, so with each
move the coin must pass far enough between the
other two coins to leave enough room for the next
move.

The game can end in four ways.

When a player moves a coin, that player loses if:


The coin fails to pass completely between the other two coins
The coin falls off the edge of the table, or
The coin touches any other coin.


That player wins if none of the above occur, and
the coin passes completely through two sides of
the opposing player's triangle of coins.

The strategy of the game is to move your coins
cautiously into range of the other player's
coins, putting them in position to take a shot
through your opponent's triangle without leaving
your coins too far apart and vulnerable to
attack. You look for an opening without leaving
yourself open. The edge of the table can be used
as a defensive position.

The game can be played in matches, playing up to
a predetermined number of wins, or best of a set
number of games.

40390.name: Hammer & Nails
40390.description:
Spin the spinner, pick a piece, and hammer it in with the little hammer.

This is a kids game that is intended to develop fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination.

It uses a small hammer, and real metal nails.

40391.name: Was ist Was: Junior – Ritterburg Kartenspiel
40391.description:
The game has an educational aim: by reading (or getting read) the texts on the cards, the children ought to learn some details on daily life on a medieval castle. In order to complete certain tasks, like "There is a feast at the castle. Eat with the nobler knights and lead the ladies to dance", you need to collect specific sets of cards (in the case of a feast: juggler, vegetables and roast).
Basically, you draw cards until you can complete one of three outlying tasks, then take the task-card, adding the worth of tasks once the pile of cards has been emptied.

40392.name: 5°Dimension Playing Card Game
40392.description:
The 5th Dimension Playing Card Game is actually a five-suited deck of playing cards based on the traditional 52-card deck. In addition to the added suit (stars), the 5D deck gives each suit its own unique color and theme. It also adds a '1' card (distinct from the ace) and a 'P' (princess) face card, as well as including a joker for each suit. Thus, the deck includes 80 cards in total.

The deck has been made available in a number of different formats that differ in packaging, accessories (such as score sheets), and game rules included. The publisher's web site www.jeudecartes5d.com provided rules for 14 games as of the end of 2008, albeit only in French.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2009 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
2009 Spiel des Jahres Nominee
2010 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
2010 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Winner
2010 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2010 JoTa Best Family Board Game Nominee
40393.description:
FITS (Fill In The Spaces) is essentially a multi-player Tetris. Each player has an inclined board on which they place different polyominoes, with three, four, or five squares. Cards are drawn from a pile to tell the players which piece to take. The pieces may be rotated and reversed before they slide down the inclined area to dock to other gaming pieces, but unlike Tetris cannot be slid horizontally once dropped. Scoring is based on quantity and configuration of squares left uncovered.

Unlike original Tetris there is no time pressure but like Tetris every player is engaged with his own board.

Official expansion:


FITS Official Expansion


Unofficial expansions:


FITS Expansion #1: MOTS – More Of The Same
FITS Expansion #2: LOTS – Letters On The Spaces
FITS Expansion #3: BOTS – Big Obnoxious Terrible Spaces


Reimplemented by:


Mini FITS
40393.name: FITS
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 4: Shogun with Tenno's Court, Gremlins, and Faster Than Light
Session Impressions: FITS (Fill In The Spaces)

40394.name: Scene It? To Go!: Jr.
40394.description:
All the fun of the original kids’ game in a compact case.
Enjoy real movie, TV, sports and music clips, trivia questions and on-screen challenges.

For Ages 8 and up, 2-8 People

40395.name: Scene It? To Go!: Disney
40395.description:
Questions based on Disney Pixar characters and movies with real movie clips and trivia questions. Comes with on-screen trivia cards and dice, 1 game DVD, game board and 4 magnetic tokens. Similar to Disney Scene it, but travel form.

* Requires a DVD player and viewing screen(not included)

40396.description: Arctic Survival is about using your instincts to prevail in the coldest and most remote place on earth. The object is to make it safely to your igloo before your opponent can make it safely to theirs. In the way are treacherous moving ice floes, with icebergs and thin ice blocking your path. Lurking within are friendly and unfriendly Orca whales and smart penguins that can guide the way across the ice floes. Once across, unfriendly polar bears, wolves and many other types of arctic wildlife confront you as you try to reach the safety and comfort of the igloo waiting across this vast ever changing environment.
40396.name: Arctic Survival

40397.name: Pirates Ahoy Game
40397.description: The pirate's are leaving port in their ships and are racing to the treasure island. As you help them sail the seven seas, guess which ship will reach the treasure island first and which will reach it last.

boardgamepublisher: Copag - Cia. Paulista de Artes Gráficas
boardgamehonor: 2009 Fairplay À la carte Winner
2009 JoTa Best Card Game Nominee
2011 JoTa Best Game Released in Brazil Nominee
40398.description:
(from the box):
The fast-paced, addictive card game where your luck can change in the play of a card! Collect 3 complete property sets, but beware Debt Collectors, Forced Deals and the dreaded Deal Breakers, which could change your fortunes at any time!

MONOPOLY DEAL - the card game where anything can happen!

How to win: Be the first player to collect 3 three full property sets of different colors.

The Cards:
Action Cards may be played to initiate the action printed on the card or may be used as money of the value noted in the upper left and lower right corners.
Property Cards some denote a specific property and some are wild. They show property name, set to which they belong (or in which sets they may be used), rental costs, number of properties in their set and their value when used to make payments.
House/Hotel Cards may be used to increase the rental cost of a property set. They also have a monetary value for use in making payments.
Money Cards are used to make payments.

Play:
Draw two cards from the draw pile, or if you start your turn with no cards, draw five.
Play up to three cards from your hand face up either as: money into your bank, properties or improvements into your collection, or actions. Action cards allow you to collect rent, receive money, take properties from others or cancel another action. Cards placed in your bank may only be used as money. When you must make a payment, you may use money from your bank or properties and improvements in your collection, but not cards in your hand.
Discard cards in excess of seven from your hand to the bottom of the draw pile.

Win by announcing it on your turn when you have three complete property sets of different colors. This ends the game.
boardgameversion: Hasbro / Parker Brothers Australia/New Zealand edition
Hasbro / Parker Brothers Chinese edition Shuffle Shaker
Hasbro / Parker Brothers English / French Canadian Edition
Hasbro / Parker Brothers Shuffle Shaker edition
Hasbro Canadian edition 2013 with robot token
Hasbro Dutch/French edition with Monopoly Shaker
Hasbro Hong Kong Coca-Cola Special Edition
40398.name: Monopoly Deal Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 24 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Micro games
44 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Hosting a Game Night
Episode 30 - When All You Need is a Deck of Cards
TDT - Episode # 308 - Mean and Nasty Games

40399.name: Monopoly: Here & Now UK Edition
40399.description: The classic Monopoly with unique properties and other elements of the United Kingdom - as voted by its citizens.

40401.description:
Mary, a.k.a. Ladybirds, contains a wooden tray with three sets of ten squared tiles with different patterns:


10 ladybugs, with each ladybug bearing a number of dots from 1 to 10
10 puddles of paint, each of a different color
10 pictures of different colors with simple shapes (umbrella, kite, worm...)


The player needs to arrange these tiles in the tray with respect to colors and/or numbers.
40401.name: Mary

40402.name: Arabian Nights
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 042: Back in the Game Design
40402.description:
This Arabian Nights adventure appeals to all ages with its fantastical tale of Abu, the little thief who befriends Achmed, the prince of Bagdad and foils the nefarious plans of the evil grand vizier Jaffar, who seizes control of Bagdad and covets the princess of Basra. From its gorgeous, epic-scale sets to flying horses, magic carpets, all-seeing crystals, blue rose of forgetfullness, and, best of all, Rex Ingram's towering Djinni of the bottle.

Free all locations and the regime headed by Jaffar from power in Basra so that Achmed was married with the princess.

40403.name: Juke Joint
40403.description:
Juke Joint is a turn-based scramble whose objective is for players to pay off their "bar tab" first. Players accomplish this by accumulating money by performing success rolls in eight different areas of the board (the Pool Room, Stage, Horsehose Pit, Jukebox, BBQ Pit, Store Room and the Crossroads) which pay money, then transporting that money back to the Bar.

Players draw "Club" cards each turn which may result in immediate actions, people encounters, or items that players can accumulate and use to increase their chances of succeeding at gigs.

Players may choose to play as one of five different classes of characters: Musician, Hustler, Driver, Drifter or Cook. Each class has its share of natural and item-related benefits.

Along the way other non-player characters may appear - "Legends" - which, should players encounter them, affect play. Legends come into play when the board's "Hot Action" counter is raised by various activities. Legends include Howlin' Wolf and Ol' Scratch.

Game is in reprints from an initial independent run.

40404.name: Spel van het jaar 1998
40404.description:
Spel van het jaar 1998 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 1997 till October 1998.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

40405.name: Spel van het jaar 2001
40405.description:
What happened in the year 2001

Spel van het jaar 2001 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 2000 till October 2001.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

40406.name: Spel van het jaar 2002
40406.description:
What happened in the year 2002?

Spel van het jaar 2002 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 2001 till October 2002.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

40407.description:
Hexe Lilli (witch Lilli) has a book with many spells. The players have to draw a randomly chosen picture from one side of the book and after a few minutes everybody has to put his picture into the middle of the table.
Depending on which pictures were drawn, the combination of these pictures have the meaning of different spells.The first player who guessed the right spell, gets three stars from the supply. One of these stars he has to give to the player whose picture he likes most.
The aim of the game is to have the most stars at the end of the game.
40407.name: Hexe Lilli macht Zauberquatsch

40408.description: A rally game designed with kids in mind, as they get to know Icelandic geography while playing it. Players draw cards with maps of Iceland on them and on the maps there are rally-routes which they must drive from start to finish. The cards provide some general information on traffic as well, to improve the knowledge of the players.
40408.name: Rallyspil

40409.name: Cross Cartes
40409.description:
A race game with tactics and luck. Plays with cards, pawns and board.

"Gobelet d'argent" winner at Boulogne Billancourt's International contest for board and card games designers for the year 1983.

40410.name: Pyramid Crawl
40410.description:
In this solo print-and-play game, you take on the role of an adventurer exploring two levels of a pyramid complex to find the Pharaoh's Tomb. Every character has Strength, Wits, and Magic stats.

Along the way, you encounter ambushes, traps, locked doors, and treasure. You might be attacked by skeletons, mummies, crocodiles, or animal-headed warriors.

If you live to find the Pharaoh's Tomb and escape, your score is the money you collect along the way.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee
2013 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Winner
40411.description:
Flames Of War! Open Fire has been carefully designed for someone who has never heard of Flames Of War before, or has seen the 256 page rulebook and not known where to start. Open Fire is not a simplified set of the Flames Of War rules, but rather a complete introductory box for a new player!

Open Fire! includes:

Complete Flames Of War full-colour mini-rulebook; 164 pages of clearly laid out rules with plenty of diagrams, including: Rules for tanks, infantry, artillery, aircraft, snipers, reconnaissance, night fighting, and more.

Special rules for the nations involved in WWII.

16 page full-colour introduction booklet. Learn the skills needed to become a famous World War II general.
6 detailed American Sherman tank miniatures.
2 detailed Sherman Firefly tank miniatures.
3 detailed German StuG G assault gun miniatures.
2 Grenadier platoons, one PaK40 platoon (72 minis, 2 AT guns)
1 US Paratrooper platoon (32 minis)
1 V1 Flying Bomb Terrain Piece
10 American dice.
10 German dice.

The introduction booklet has been written to work in conjunction with the mini-rulebook included with the set.

Its aim is to introduce you to the basic mechanics of the Flames Of War rules and to help you navigate your way through the rulebook for your first couple of games. Once you've played through the missions included, you should be ready for your first full battles.

This is truly where the war begins for your reinforcements!

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.
40411.name: Flames of War: Open Fire

40412.name: Fan Tan
40412.description:
This game is different from the card game Fan Tan.
For the Piecepack Games version, see Piecepack Fan Tan.

Stewart Culin describes it in his book "The Gambling Games of the Chinese in America" as:

"a game usually played upon a mat-covered table, with a quantity of Chinese coins or other small objects which are covered with a cup. The players guess what remainder will be left when the pile is divided by four, and bet upon the result. The name means "repeatedly spreading out," and refers to the manner in which the coins or other objects are spread out upon the table."

The equipment needed to play include:

The playing mat (called the t'an ching)
Coins, buttons, or something that is numerous and can be spread out
A cup or cover for the coins (called a t'an kun)
A rod used to separate the coins (called a t'an pong)

It takes two people to run the game, One is called the "t'an kun" (ruler of the spreading out) and the other one is called the "ho kun" who acts as a cashier.

Culin writes that the game is believed to have been invented by Kwan Chung, a renowned statesmen of antiquity who died in 645BC. Culin also mentions the likelihood that the game was invented for soldiers as a way for them to pass the time in camp.

This game is identical to the Phillipine game Capona.

40413.description:
Game description: The First Italy Campaign (1796-1797) was actually the most brilliant military expedition of the French Revolutionary Wars.The Lodi manoeuver was also, strategically thinking, a large flanking operation against Beaulieu’s army.
“Au pont de Lodi” is a simulation of the May 10, 1796 battle, which opened the way to general Bonaparte’s triumph over the Austrian Lombardische Armée, leading his Italy’s army towards the seize of Milan. The Battle of Lodi was not a decisive engagement, since the Austrian army had successfully escaped. But it became a central element in the Napoleonic myth and, according to Napoleon himself, contributed to convincing him that he was superior to other generals, and that his destiny would lead him to achieve great things.

The game uses the 'La Bataille series' rules from Clash of Arms. The Rulebook is intended to be a rough guide to tactical warfare in the last Eighteenth Century and in the beginning of the “age of Napoleon”.

Note: The series rules are not included in the game. Rules from any La Bataille game can be used or they must be downloaded. Both the full rules and the simple Marie Louise rules can be used.
40413.name: Au Pont de Lodi

40414.description:
The players try to win the election day for the German parliament called Bundestag.
During his move the player may choose between moving his pawn to another area or performing a election campaign by placing chips, after throwing a die.
During the game every results are determined in each land and the player adds her own percentage of votes together.
The game ends when all lands are decided. The player with the most votes wins the election.

This game is published as Spielbox Edition No.7 in Spielbox issue 1/1994.
40414.name: Wahltag

40415.name: Beint í mark
40415.description: A simple football (soccer game) where players roll dice to move the ball and try to score. Players can land on special spots, get yellow or red cards and so on. Penalty shoot-out is possible as well.

40416.description:
Your quiet afternoon playing video games is interrupted by a whirring noise and a loud bang! You rush to the window and look. Out on the neighboring field you see it - A large flying saucer and dozens of angry looking MARTIANS!!! Well, at least your day won’t be boring!

Martians!!! Drops you into the middle of the first wave of a large-scale alien invasion. Armed with only your vast knowledge of sci-fi movies you decide that it is up to you to save mankind from certain intergalactic slavery.

First things first, let’s get the gaming group together!

Game includes 32 map tiles, 50 cards, character cards, chits, dice and 100 Martians!!!

Part of the Zombies!!! series.
40416.name: Martians!!!

40417.description:
2 to 4 players try to build up a palace consisting of 8 parts from which only up to six are used.Players bid with gold cards to bribe officials called Maharadschahs and then activate special actions in order to collect material for propping up the palace. Each player has her own player sheet to set the gold cards. There are 5 special actions. For each action one gold card is laid out. Whoever has played the most valuable gold card for each action is awarded the turn action. All other gold cards left over can later on be exchanged for victory points. Later on players can participate in building parts of the palace. There are some special bonus cards as well. You get them by sacrificing victory points and have only one time use.Additional support is earned by laying down material to so called premium award fields at the palace. Players receive victory points after having build highly prized palace places or by exchanging played gold cards for their single actions.

Online play


Jeux sur un Plateau (turn-based)
40417.name: Der Palast von Eschnapur

40418.name: Land O' Sugar
40418.description:
From the back:

Remember playing boardgames like Candyland? You were an innocent kid with a dumb hair cut wishing so "bad" you were playing something else like "Super Colossal Master of All Elementary Schools or Ruler of All the Fudgesicles in the Freezer!" Your super strength allowing you to flick your opponent across the orange shag carpet? Well... Your wishes have come true. With The Wild Wigout Comix Gameboards!

Land o' Sugar was one of seven crazy art boardgames produced by Scairy Hairy Toys, San Fransisco in the early to mid-1990s. Each was created by a local underground artist and each was handmade, silk-screened and extremely limited.

Land o' Sugar takes the player into the wonderful world of sugar. The game requires one pound of hard round candies to play. It came with a brightly colored silk-screened boardgame with a pinwheel pixie spinner and three mutant sugar eating game pieces. The object of the game was to get to the end without passing out from an over-indulgence of sugar or throwing up. The game was created by illustrator David Fremont best known for his strange comics and silk-screened concert posters.

40419.description:
Every player has 4 different pawns with values from 1 to 4. On his turn he can move one pawn so many unoccupied spaces like the value of this pawn shows. If the moved pawn is on a space with the same number as his value the player can take it from the board. The first player who gets all his pawns off the board wins.

Published in Spielbox 4/2006
40419.name: Nichts wie raus hier

40420.description: Awesome Bots is a short card game in which you draft and then play through your deck of robot cards, battling for the best score. The structure of the game allows you to filter through what you've gotten, and you won't be playing most of what you draft. All but the lowest-valued cards have a cost, requiring you to spend cards you've already played. You must either "scrap" a certain value's worth of robots, sending them out of the game, or "upgrade" them, saving those points for later. Balancing the risky but high-valued scrapping bots and the safer but less rewarding upgrading bots, keeping in mind the values and types in your deck's makeup, is central to the game. The game can be played cutthroat with 2 to 4 players or as a partners game of 2 on 2.
40420.name: Awesome Bots

40421.description: Malta! is an easy-to-learn, light strategy/group game for at least two players. On a modular board with moving, turning, and disappearing spaces, players vie for a good board position and a strong hand. On every turn, players draw based on their piece's location, play half their cards, and move. They lose if they run out of cards during their turn or are on a space where they cannot move. The cards' effects vary from useful to nasty, and so playing more cards may be more of a curse than a blessing. As players get eliminated, will you be the only player to not lose?
40421.name: Malta!

40422.name: Global Warming
40422.description: This is a slowly sinking island game like Survive: Escape from Atlantis! or Atlantis. It uses a unique method for determining which parts of the island will sink next that gives the players partial knowledge of future events.

40423.name: Civil War "Blast from the Past"
40423.description:
Civil War "Blast from the Past" is a game for children. It involves a 32 page booklet that contain the rules, assorted trivia of the Civil War and most importantly, the answers to the questions on the cards in the game!

It is a game where you move to a space and according to what the space is that you landed on, you pick up a card. This can result in moving further, hampering your opponent or answering a trivia question.

There are also several sets of stickers that come with the game that are placed on a small map showing decisive battles of the Civil War.

40424.name: Ellipse
40424.description:
From the Instruction booklet:

"ELLIPSE has a simple premise, but unusual tactics that you will enjoy for minutes at a time, or for repeated ROUND AFTER ROUND OF FUN!!"

Game includes
-vinyl roll up board (similar to vinyl chess mats)
-48 "jewels" in primary color (glass beads)
-2 "jewels" in secondary color for alternate "8 ball" rules.

The board features a series of circles and ellipses all intersecting at tangents and perpendiculars. Players take turns removing jewels from one shape (circle, or ellipse). The player who takes the last jewel loses. Strategy involves controlling the number removed on your turn by selecting intersecting shapes to either increase or decrease the number you take that turn, thus hopefully forcing your opponent to take the final piece.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
40425.description: The players explore the islands of Polynesia. The winner is the player who scores the most points from putting tiles on his display. Palms, huts, shells, and boats on the tiles influence the scoring. It can be played with 2 to 5 players.
40425.name: Maori
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 46 - Council Chamber: Big Episode on Small Games

40427.name: Emergency Action
40427.description: This roll-and-move game is designed to teach players about first aid. Each turn, the current player rolls a special die (featuring the numbers 1 through 4, a plus, and a minus). If a number is rolled, the player moves forward; pluses are re-rolled, and minuses cause a turn to be lost. Some spaces have special actions (roll again, go back to start, etc.), while others require the player to answer a question about first aid. If the player is unable to answer correctly, he or she must stay on the square and continue answering questions on subsequent turns until successful. Special "first aid station" spaces give "first aid fact" cards which may be used as references when answering questions. The first player to make it all the way around the board wins.

40428.name: Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945
40428.description:
Battlewagons is a complete standalone game. It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible. If you own Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Battlewagons.

Scenarios include:

Denmark Strait, May 1941
Death of the Bismarck, May 1941
Battle of the River Plate, Dec 1939
Hypothetical Italian Sortie
Tirpitz sortie (hypothetical)
US vs. Japan (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters (British, German, French, Italian, American and Japanese)
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


Battleship Captain


Preceded by:


Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906
Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!.

40429.name: Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906
40429.description:
Tsushima is a complete standalone game. It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible. If you own Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Tsushima.

Scenarios include:

Tsushima
Tsushima (variant)
Britain vs. Germany or France (hypothetical)
Rule Britannia (hypothetical)
Pacific Supremacy (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


Battleship Captain


Followed by:


Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919
Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!

40430.name: Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919
40430.description:
Grand Fleet is a complete standalone game. It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible. If you own Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Grand Fleet.

Scenarios include:

Dogger Bank, Jan 1915
Falklands, Dec 1914
Goeben vs. Cruiser Squadron, Aug 1914
Nation vs. Nation (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters (British, French, German, Italian)
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


Battleship Captain


Preceded by:


Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906


Followed by:


Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!.

40431.description:
Every player starts with one dishes pawn and three scoring pawns (respectively one for pears, green and red apples).

The board shows 36 dishes with apples and pears. At the borders are scoring tracks for red and green apples coming - from the left side of the board - and for pears - coming from the right side of the board.

On ones turn all players play one subsurfaced card. The highest card goes to the start player, the second highest to his left neighbor.

Now all players play the cards in front of them in sequence. First a player moves his dishes pawn according to his card. After this he can move one of his three scoring pawns in order to get more points for each.

The play ends when one player moves his pear scoring pawn on the same field of one of his apple pawns. The players now count all points for their three scoring pawns together. The player with the highest number of points wins.

Äpfel und Birnen is Number 74 of Edition Spielbox published in issue 2/2006.
40431.name: Äpfel und Birnen

40432.description:
This game is a revision and update of the classic game of Stratego. It is similar to the latter, in which the purpose is to capture the enemy's flag after secretly placing your units; but here are included new graphics, board, components, and rules.

Stratego: Revised Edition has two rules sets: those of Classic Stratego; and the main ruleset including special movement and attack rules---new for most of the pieces. All pieces' powers are printed in the rules and on the gameboard. The board is smaller (8 x 10 vs. 10 x 10), and there are fewer pieces (30 vs. 40) than in Stratego.

This edition is set in a fantasy realm with pieces such as Dragons, Dwarves, and Elves replacing the traditional Napoleonic soldiers and theme of Classic Stratego. One player is the Fire (Red) Army from Volcandria, and the other player is the Ice (Blue) Army from Everwinter (hence, the game's nickname Stratego: Fire & Ice).

Re-implements:

Stratego
40432.name: Stratego (Revised Edition)

40433.name: Crazy Old Fish War
40433.description:
From the Publisher:

Four card games you know and love are shuffled into one simple, fast exciting game. Be the first to get rid of all your cards in this crazy game! Match, Go Fish, or declare War on each turn—your Crazy 8s will help you along the way. And don’t forget the Old Mermaid’s special powers, but play her at a price! CRAZY OLD FISH WAR card game combines the best parts of your favorite card games!

40434.name: Quebec: je me souviens
40434.description: In this trivia game, explore Quebec province by trying to answer questions in 6 categories: history, culture, science, geography, sport and misc.

40435.name: Quebec in a box
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
40435.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly variant based on Quebec City.

40436.name: Zombeja! Ovella!
40436.description:
Zombeja! Ovella! is Finnish language storytelling boardgame for 3-6 players, One game takes about 30 minutes per player.

Like in most traditional roleplaying games each session starts with creation of character concept. Zombeja! Ovella! utilizes "charactersticks", short wooden sticks with different qualities like personality types and generalizations printed on them to create instant stereotypes suited for genre.

Game combines competitive and co-operative play elements in storytelling to produce a structured roleplaying exercise that simulates thematic elements of survival horror movies.

Players have to create conflict of interest to eliminate other players and to advance their own position on the board. Co-operation of others is required to survive but some need to be sacrificed.

Originally a free mini-game with issue #8 of Finnish language roleplaying games magazine Roolipelaaja the game was released later packaged in VHS tape case to make it look indie zombie flick.

Zombeja! Ovella! is predecessor to English language game Zombie Cinema which essentially streamlined version of it.

40437.name: Cognition
40437.description:
From the publisher:

What type of thinker are you? Are you a lateral thinker, a critical thinker, instinctive or destructive? Would you describe yourself as creative or deductive? A Mr Spock type or more like The Riddler? Does your approach to life mirror the sharp analysis of Sherlock Holmes, or the poetry of Shakespeare?

No matter what your style, Cognition is a game that is guaranteed to test your mental stamina and tickle your funny bone in equal measure!

Ask yourself, how well do you know the person sitting next to you? Are your ESP powers in good shape? Perhaps you’re a whiz at solving codes but do you have any idea what your car number plate is? You might be as wise as Yoda, but do you know the names of Frank Zappa’s first two children?

So, if you can combine strategy with smarts, have a bit of luck, can manipulate others without them realizing it, have a knack for languages and a memory for things everyone else has forgotten they ever knew, you’re on your way to becoming a Cognition master!

40438.name: Ísland: íslenska spurningaspilið
40438.description: A trivia game about Iceland. There are six categories of questions: History, culture, nature, geography, sports and miscellaneous. Collect a token from each category to win. The players roll a die to move and then they must answer a question from the category they land on.
